Reviews.Title: “C37 napili point”
Reviews.Author: familyvaca2012
Reviews.Content: we recently returned from a lovely stay at Napili point C-37. The condo is very comfortable for a family of four, well stocked, and owners are very helpful with arrangements and any incidentals. The ocean view is wonderful, the beds are comfy with foam mattress toppers, and the beach is a quick 5 minute walk through the parking lot rather than the path if you have a large cooler. The snorkeling cove is wonderful for sea life and very safe for all ages however climbing in over lava rock can be a bit tricky without water shoes. Take advantage of all the recommendations referred to in other reviews. Highly recommend surfing lessons in Ka'anapali in front of the Marriot. MaiTais at Beach Bums at the Maui Aquarium harbor are delicious. Aquarium is a great place to visit to see sea life, and learn about the area. Can't say enough about the whales! Get out on the water one way or another! The condo has lots of water sports equipment however if you want a better fit for snorkeling, we rented at Boss Frogs next to the Napili Market 3 blocks away from the condo. Napili Market is a good food store if you don't hit Costco when you land. we will definitely stay at C-37 again when vacationing in Napili, Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Family time in Maui!! We will be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScooterScantland
Reviews.Content: Aloha This was our second trip to Maui and once again we rented at Napili Point resort. We rented unit B-37 and my daughter and her family rented C-37 above us. This is the second year we have rented both of these units and it works well with lots of family. Thanks to John B-37 and Patty C-37 for there help with booking these condos. Condos are located very near the pool and BBQ area and offer excellent views of the turtles in the cove and the whales breaching further out. Both of these condos are very well stocked with everything you will need and are like a home away from home! Snorkeling was awesome with lots of fish and turtles and Napili Bay is just a short walk along the shoreline. Breakfast at the Gazebo is highly recommended and there is now a water sports rental place next door that is great for boogie boards and snorkeling equipment. We love going to Maui and hopefully can return again next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great time at Napili Point”
Reviews.Author: Nick911
Reviews.Content: Second stay in Napili at Napili Point. Note, can only speak to the specific rental room and about the resort in general as the room we rented was via VRBO directly from owner. Unit C37: ideally located in the resort, both close to the pool, small lobby area, and parking. The condo is a second floor unit with large balcony with direct ocean, pool, and garden views. The condo was very well equipped with everything you might need including bino's to watch the whales, and copius amounts of snorkle equipment, sand toys, rock shoes, and boogie boards. I especially enjoyed having the little things like a cooler bag and frosty mugs, nice little vacation touches that were handy but things too big or bulky to pack. Everything was clean, functional, and the owners were excellent to deal with. Our only hiccup was upon arrival the key box was missing, however, a call to the emergency contact number provided by the owners had us in the unit within 10 minutes (the maid had forgot the key box inside the condo). Highly recommend! The resort: well located close to Lahaina (10 min) and walking distance to a beach. Pools and grounds were well maintained, grills worked well and were clean, and as far as I can tell they have 24-hour security on the resort as in a uniformed patrolling security guard. The snorkelling in the small cove that the resort overlooks is world class and multiple close encounters with turtles are guaranteed! Whales were going crazy in late February, and at any given time I could look into the ocean and see whales. The resort is a 5 minute walk (or closer depending on your unit) to The Gazebo Restaurant where they serve the best breakfast around (be prepared to wait in line 15 minutes plus). There is also a popular surf break off the point of this resort and was entertained daily by some very good local surfers on the waves. Only drawback for us as a young family with 2 kids is that there were not many other kids around (a plus for some). We stayed at Napili Shores nextdoor to this resort for the second part of our trip and found there were much more kids running around, which is good if you have kids and want them to make friends and play while you lounge by the pool. Conclusion here is that if you want quiet, choose Napili Point, if you want your kids running around with other kids, choose Napili Shores. Overall another great trip in Maui, and will visit again, and again. Would recommend this resort. Do in Maui: highly recommend the Road to Hana, a Luau, renting a convertible, visiting Front Street in Lahaina, going whale watching, snorkling Molikini, trying a Mai Tai, visiting the blowholes north of Napili, taking a surfing lesson, and visiting Fleming Beach (be careful in the big waves). Feel free to message with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “(Update) Still wonderful but PLEASE BRING BACK MAI-TAI PARTY!!”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: If anything, the thrill of returning to Napili Point each year is even more pronounced than during our first stay. The descent past the Office and along the cove with the turtles on one side, views of Lana'i and Moloka'i on another remains magical. Each year we try to reserve for the following year for a month. We know that if any problems arise, Rod or Keith will handle matters immediately. We also come to look forward to the marvelous staff, including Arlene (who should be canonized), Dan, Rolly, Doming, Liza.... There are so many! We know that twenty or so turtles will still be out there along with surfers on a windy day. And we also know that our night's sleep will be absolutely guaranteed, especially when the tide comes in to provide natural "white noise." But this year, something happened. Apparently last May, the Board decided to cancel the Mai-Tai parties. Depending on whom one contacts, the reasons vary from questions of liability, who should fund the events, or why should one or two members fund a social event during which alcohol is served. Irrespective of reasons, these functions serve as a valuable means for guests to mingle with one another. Every Monday, two or three staff members would serve mai-tai's or punch and taro chips from 5 to 6 PM. During this time acquaintances and friendships were made. As this is a resort, it makes sense to provide this kind of social opportunity. To the naysayers who object to serving alcohol, I should add that a majority of guests choose punch or simply abstain altogether. The important thing is for the association and owners alike work for the good of the guests. After all, the other resorts along Napili Bay provide these events for their--why not Napili Point Resort? This is certainly not a deal breaker, but shouldn't NPR live up to its reputation as a unique destination? We are confident that with a little common sense Monday's between 5 and 6 will once again be special.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Expected!”
Reviews.Author: roaminrose
Reviews.Content: My family (my parents, me, my husband, my adult siblings, and toddler niece) spent a week at Napili Point Resort between Christmas and New Years. We had two 2-BR condos that overlooked the rocky bay. We had a great experience! The condos and property were clean and well-maintained. The condos were well stocked with cooking equipment. Beds were comfortable. The views could not be beat. We would wake up, walk down the 3 minute path to the rocky bay, go snorkeling (there are tons of sea turtles in that bay!), go back to the condo to eat a leisurely breakfast on the lanai (again, watching the turtles popping up in the bay), walk the 5-7 minute path to Napili Bay, spend several hours on the beach, return to the condo for happy hour and dinner on the lanai and then just relax for the evening. Every day. It was amazing. The location is perfect for families and groups because it is so easy to snorkel or go to the beach. You don't have to wait for everyone in the group to be ready, or want to do the same thing, because you can just meet at the beach. There is a Snorkel Bobs within walking distance so it is easy to rent snorkel and paddle board equipment. There is also a market (Napili Market) that is about a mile and a half away. That market is a full supermarket. Kaanapali Beach is about a 15 minute drive. I would definitely recommend renting a car as Napili is a bit removed from everything else (part of what makes it lovely). My only complaint about the condos was that the bathrooms did not have great ventilation (no windows in the shower/toilet room) and toiletries were only replenished once during the week we were there (the condo was cleaned beautifully every day). This is a small detail and, if you have read my other reviews, you know that bathrooms tend to be a point of pickiness for me anyway... I would stay again at the Napili Point!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED MAUI AND NAPILI POINT RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Blee53686
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first time in Hawaii and had such an amazing time. The resort was just perfect and the condo we stayed in could not be better. It was right on the beach and even had an outdoor shower to wash off the sand. If you are going to be in Lahaina you must stay in condo A1. GREAT LOCATION FOR YOUR MONEY! It is the closest condo to the beautiful sandy beach.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point Resort is my only choice on Maui”
Reviews.Author: RBars123
Reviews.Content: I just read the previous review from Cleo1117. I want to write how much I disagree with her evaluation of not only A1 but Napili Point Resort! I have stayed in A and B units for 30 years. My family first vacationed there when I was only 9 years old. I have continued the tradition by sharing the experience with my husband, on our honeymoon, and taking our two children for family vacations. All of the units provide a beautiful and unique experience to watch the sunsets. The surfers are always out in the ocean to entertain the guests. The snorkeling with the turtles is another plus at Napili Point Resort. Cleo1117 stated that the parking lot was 3 groups of steps away from the lower units. The land is built on a slope so there must be steps to get to the lower units. She stated that the owner had locked cabinets in the kitchen of unit A1. My understanding is that each owner has locked cabinets because they need a place to put their personal belongings when they are away from their condos. The kitchen is fully stocked with kitchen utensils and gadgets to cook any meal, and there are ample kitchen cabinets to store purchased food. How much cupboard space does Cleo1117 need? I have vacationed at Napili Point my entire life and want everyone to experience the wonderful times my family has shared over the years!

Reviews.Title: “Not All Units Are Equal”
Reviews.Author: Cleo1117
Reviews.Content: The grounds at Napili Point Resort are amazing and the sound of the surf is like having your own private sound machine near you at all times. With that said, I have to describe how our vacation started at Napili Point Resort. We booked our trip one year in advance, booking five nights to finish out a three week stay on Maui. We were booking for less than one week and we understood that we would not get to choose our condo, but we paid for one of the condos located on the point so that we would get an ocean front condo. We arrived exactly at the check in time and the process was quick. We were directed to Suite A1. Parking near A1 is difficult and it gave us quite a walk with our luggage considering there were three groups of steps to go down and no elevators for any location on the property. We entered the unit with great expectations only to be disappointed. The furnishings were 1970â€™s, with a Herculon fabric covered sofa popular in the 70's. Half the kitchen cabinets were locked and reserved exclusively for the ownerâ€™s use, the cheap chrome towel rack in the bath room was bent to the extent that it needed to be replaced, and some of the hallway wall was sponge painted a dabbled blue to resemble water. The tile did not match throughout the unit due to replacing the part located in the bathroom and leaving the rest with older and a different color tile. The unit is located about 20 feet from the community outdoor shower so small crowds gathered, the side walk was only 4 feet from our patio so there were plenty of people walking very close to where we were trying to relax, and the worst of allâ€¦..this unit was located just above the â€œsmoking hole.â€� Guests who needed to smoke would light up while still on the property and then move on down to the rocks which technically was off property. We could smell the smoke on our patio and in our unit whenever this happened. The next morning we requested a move to another unit based on the age and condition of the furnishings and the smoking issue. The manager was able to move us to unit C9 an ocean view suite that was reasonably nice with a couple of exceptions. This unit looked directly over the pool. The furnishings were a high grade rattan, comfortable sofa and additional chairs and a beautiful balcony. The kitchen cabinets were of much higher quality than the unit A1. The only problem with this unit was worn and dirty carpet which turned our bare feet black and an abundance of miniature ants in the bathroom and kitchen. We lost some food to the ants before we discovered them. The manager did send some ant bates to us once we reported the ants. The ant bates were useless, but we managed. My husband ask about a refund for the difference in price for the unit since we were not moved to another one on the point. We were told that they would have to upgrade an ocean view guest to the A1 ocean point, therefore no refund would be given. I feel the owner of the unit should have to absorb any loss due to the condition of the condo. There is a drastic difference in the quality of the furnishings and the decorating of Unit A1 and other units at the Resort. This owner clearly needs to make improvements to the unit. Napali Point Resort describes walking to a sand beach implying reasonable accessibility. The walk to the sand beach is a difficult one with signs warning those who venture the trail that accidents can happen. Napili Point wants to advertise the sand beach as close by, but in my opinion does not want to take any responsibility for the safety of its guests. Our maid service was very good. Our housekeeper was very nice and friendly. When she found out we were moving into her unit, she came right away to help us. It was the only help that we had in relocating. There are no luggage carts since every unit has some kind of steps. You are on your own to get your luggage and things to your unit. My 69 year old husband had to carry most everything himself. The sunsets are beautiful from the point and so I will not say that Napili Point Resort is a terrible place to stay, just be advised that not all units are the same and you may get unit A1 or one just like it. Even though you get to choose a unit if you are booking seven days or more, we were told by the manager that that rule didnâ€™t apply for guests receiving any type of discount. Looking at their rate list it is apparent that most everyone is getting a discount even if itâ€™s only the buy 4 nights and get 1 night free. We met several guests who return year after year and are happy with the resort; however, I brought one woman guest to our unit A1 to show her it's condition and she said â€œOh, this is a very tired oneâ€�. So it was not my expectations that were higher than the norm, the unit is indeed in need of redecorating.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views, close to swimming and snorkelling, everything you need at the condo.”
Reviews.Author: susan j
Reviews.Content: C-37 condo was a delightful place to stay for ten days of relaxation and fun. The condo is situated such that it directly faces the turtle bay. A short walk to the next beach brings you to a wonderful place to watch for whales. A few minutes more, and you come to the beach where you can swim and snorkel. The condo supplied very nice snorkeling equipment for everyone, as well as beach chairs, coolers, beach towels, games and movies, and everything else we could think of while there. The washer/dryer in the unit helped us keep ahead of sandy towels and bathing suits. We cooked some meals there and ate them on the balcony with the sunset in the background. Other nights we tried the restaurant next door, which was delicious, and then a "hole in the wall" type "mixed plate" Chinese restaurant that was clearly popular with the locals. We hope that we can come back to this condo next year.

Reviews.Title: “Left early due to cockroaches.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our highly anticipated trip to Maui 2 days ago. We were very disappointed with Napili Point Resort, so much so that we opted to leave early and move to another hotel (Westin Maui Ocean Villas). First the good. The location was excellent. You are close to a bay containing hundreds of turtles and a 5 min walk from an excellent beach. Now the bad. We stayed in B-36 and it appeared to not have been renovated, painted, walls/furniture cleaned since the early 70's. Grime had built up on the rattan furniture to the point I didn't feel comfortable sitting on them. We travelled with an infant, so on one night my wife went out to get formula from the fridge for him. There was a big crunch. She came running back, said she had stepped on a huge cockroach. I went out and sure enough there it was. Of course, I understand it might be hard to contain pests in a tropical environment but with a baby crawling around the last thing we wanted him to encounter would be cockroaches. We explained this to the gentleman at the front desk and his reply was "You must have left the front door open" (we hadn't) and then "Don't worry about it, we'll set out some traps". The resort did not look full so we had hoped they would move us to another unit. We decided to give it another try and hope the traps worked. The following day we found a baby cockroach so that was it for us. We figured B-36 has a cockroach family living in it. We decided to switch hotels and managed for the same rate to get a 1 bedroom 2 queen beds at the Westin Maui Ocean Villas for the same rate that we paid for our 2 bedroom condo at Napili Point. Needless to say things were more cramped but now we were in the lap of luxury -jacuzzi bath, kitchen with all utensils, etc. Other issues with our condo were the absolute lack of anything useful, save for one boogy board (which due to the lack of a B-36 stamp I'm assuming was left behind by another visitor). We stayed in Kona the year prior and the condo there had snorkel gear, beach chairs, ice chest, etc. It really seems that the owner of this unit doesn't care about the enjoyment of the people he/she rents to. That is likely why he/she doesn't rent it directly and instead lets the property managers rent it. So my advice, if you decide to stay here, is to rent through an owner directly via VRBO or something similar. At least that way you get to see photos of your exact unit, know exactly what is in your unit and research reviews on exactly your unit. Don't be like us and rent through Napili's website and get stuck with what must have been their dingiest unit available.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Holiday Location”
Reviews.Author: westeddy54
Reviews.Content: On a last minute whim, my husband and I took our 2 grown children and vacationed in Maui for 6 days between Christmas and New Years. We lucked into staying at Napili Point Resort. Our 2 bedroom condo suited our needs exactly! The unit was spacious, quiet, well stocked (full kitchen, lanai furniture, beach equipment etc) and there was room for everyone to have private space and a good night's sleep. It has an excellent location for snorkeling, access to sandy beaches and watching the sunsets. The staff was courteous, responded to our questions and needs and we were pleased with the service. Using the common path through the adjacent condo resort, we had access to a wonderful bay filled with turtles, fish and coral reef. Using the walkways the other way, we had access to a sandy beach with wonderful waves and scenery. We loved being able to cook our meals (BBQs are on the property) and dine watching the ocean, the whales and the sunsets. The location is close to other beaches, stores/malls and Lahania so that we did not feel isolated in one spot. Napili Point is called a Resort but does not have the fancy restaurants,spas and loud toursits. What is does have is divine Hawaiian nature and beauty! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A different review than most”
Reviews.Author: Kalena R
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I was really excited to stay at Napili Point. But after being there I would prefer to stay somewhere else next time. It's important for future visitors to know that the service standards are quite low here. For example, I was refused help printing a boarding pass because "the phone might ring." I was told that gnats were "tropical and there's nothing we can do about that," (as the bugs were crawling on my toothbrush). I was told to call back later because "housekeeping is too busy right now" when I tried to follow up on an item I left behind. I've heard the rumor that Hawaii in general has a laid back customer service attitude, but the service failures we received, as listed above, as well as housekeeping not sweeping or mopping the entire week and leaving the soaps on the stairs instead of bringing them up the stairs, just seems to me, not so much laid back as unprofessional. On another note, please be aware that the turtle cove and sandy beach are not available for people who are not very agile. To access the beach you must traverse slippery rocks with no clear path and the cove is only accessed by using the very rocky shoreline to climb in and out with strong currents trashing you about. I work in a 5 diamond, 4 star hotel, and while staying at a condo property is different for obvious reasons, I still expect a certain level of professionalism when spending a significant amount of money. I didn't even receive a call back when I expressed my concerns. Overall, I'd suggest another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much anticipation; some disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Kiana326
Reviews.Content: We looked forward to our stay at Napili Point for several months prior to our December 24th arrival. We watched for updates and photos on Facebook too. The location was beautiful and provided opportunities for snorkeling within steps of our condo on the point. Reading many reviews prior to our visit and talking to some guests while there, we were certain we had made the right choice for our holiday week in Maui. While we understand that we were allowed access to someone's home during our stay, we still had expectations of the staff who were managing the condo and property. Both my daughter and I are in the hospitatility industry in Las Vegas at prominent hotels. We provide 100% customer service to guests every day. That's our job. That's what we get paid to do. Our service expectations at Napili Point were not met, unfortunately. While we did not let the several customer service issues ruin our long-awaited vacation, we were disappointed in the staff and responses all the same. Our experience began with check-in, housekeeping, maintenance and continued through check-out and a follow-up phone call for a misplaced item after our return home. If you decide to stay at Napili Point, just know this going in, don't let poor customer service ruin your vacation and enjoy the sunsets, whales, turtles, beautiful vista from the lanai and all the wonderful opportunites that Maui has to offer. We took advantage of as many of these as possible (and have written reviews for these as well). Note: The path between Napili Shores and the beach next door and the Gazebo restaurant should be traversed with care and I would not recommend it for anyone with mobility concerns. It is rocky and slippery. Much easier to either walk down the main road or drive over and park. Access to the cove for turtle snorkeling is better gained by heading to the apartments next door and using their access. Otherwise, you will need leg and arm strength to enter and exit the area out front of the point area. See other reviews for additional information about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Always go back . . . .”
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Napili Point at least nine or ten times. Our first visit was in 1988. We've brought our kids and family and friends. We now visit as a couple and stay in the point oceanfront 1-bedrooms. This is absolutely the best place to relax, snorkel, explore, swim, and sunbathe on Maui. If you are looking for a snooty, swanky, super expensive spa resort, then this is not for you. . . . leave Napili Point for the rest of us!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, totally relaxing slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Pacsnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napili Point in early December and stayed at Napili Point for 10 nights. For a couple wanting a quiet, romantic getaway, this place is awesome. Located on the west side of Maui, north of all the high-rise, dense resort development of Kaanapali, this is different. Located on a cove, the condos feel private, low key, and afford the most incredible sunsets and snorkeling right out your back lanai. Each "B" level unit has a private lanai with a grassy lawn over looking the wAter. No elevators or long walk through lobbies to get outside; simply open your slider. Spotted whales while drinking coffee in the morning, swam with sea turtles in the afternoon in the cove. The grounds were well kept, and the condo perfectly fine, while not super luxurios. Who cares because the location is where it's at! Go, you will not regret it. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: travelbug33048
Reviews.Content: Great spot , great snorkeling, great views, and great service ( especially Keith who is the assistant manager and man"s the desk most days!)

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point A-15 was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at Napili in A-15, this is a ground level one bedroom unit, with no unit directly above. It was great to arrive to the sound of the ocean waves and warm sunshine right from our lanai. The Unit was clean, well furnished, and a pleasure to move into for a week. The staff are very friendly, and it was nice to have daily housekeeping services to keep everything fresh. The unit has non-essentials there too â€“ board games, several DVD movies and music CDs, as well as beach chairs, floatation devices and boogie boards. We also enjoyed the barbeques on the property, so much that we did not go out for dinner even once. It is truly a special place â€“ now we have to try to sort through hundreds of pictures taken from the condo !

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem tucked away in the Napili Shores”
Reviews.Author: AragornTheStrider
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have had a better stay in Hawaii. We were looking for a quiet, charming experience away from the large commercial resorts on the west coast of Maui and we found this jewel on TripAdvisor (as always TA to help!) This is a rental condominium community and the condos are individually owned and rented through management. We called up and booked over the phone. We got a deal where we got 1 night free on 4 nights. The place has amazing views of the ocean from the balcony of living room. Our Unit B-41 was very well equipped with all the kitchen amenities and utensils. It had a washer-dryer in the unit and pretty much everything you need including detergent, cleaning liquids etc that you need for a longer stay. They also provide free maid service. The rooms very clean and well maintained. The management is very friendly. Since this was our anniversary celebration, they had assigned one of the best condos to us. Now one thing to keep in mind is that they don't have direct beach access. You have to walk a bit to reach the beach area. Gazebo the restaurant is a short walk away (It's a highly overrated restaurant, but that's another story). Napili is a very nice area if you are looking to stay away from the busy beach areas of Kaanapali and Lahaina. It's about 20 minutes drive from Lahaina. All in all, an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's also a turtle home!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTea
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for 5 days and we both loved it! Three big turtles also live at the bay. It's almost a guarentee to see them everyday there! A must-stay for people who like to snorkel and who want to swim with turtles!

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Wait To Get Back”
Reviews.Author: SuesHusband
Reviews.Content: We visited Napili Point Resort for the first time and can hardly wait until we can return. We had a terrific one bedroom/one bathroom Ocean View unit on the ground floor. The unit was nicely appointed with updated kitchen appliances, although we spent most of our time on the lanai looking at the cove and ocean beyond so I can't say how comfortable the couch was. The kitchen was fully equipped with all of the utensils, silver, and flatware you could need. The view was incredible, whether the sea was calm or when the waves were breaking as they did on our last day in paradise. Watching the surfers was better than anything on television (although there were two of them in our unit we probably never watched more than about five minutes' worth the whole time we were there; just too many other great things to do when you are in Maui). The cove is a moment's walk from the condos and easily accessed for some terrific snorkeling with the sea turtles and colorful fish. Napili Beach is less than five minutes away and an easy stroll along a semi-paved path behind the next resort --- nice waves for mild body surfing, snorkeling, and more sea turtles to look at. Easy drive to Kahana (grocery & casual dining), Ka'anapali (shopping & more upscale dining), and Lahaina (pretty much anything you want to buy or eat). In all, convenient to get almost anywhere from the resort. The cost was certainly reasonable, and Napili Point offers many discount offers. If there is anything negative, it would be that the interior of the ground level (A) units are in plain view of everyone who passes by (and there are a lot of people passing by). That said, we met many nice people as they strolled past and said hello. Remember to pull the curtains for privacy. The folks that we encountered were all very pleasant and obviously happy to be there. Arlene took care of our room daily, and could not be more pleasant. She was always ready to answer any questions that we had and is a wonderful representative. There was a wide variety of folks staying at the resort from newlyweds, young and established families, middle aged and mature couples. Make time one morning to walk over to the Gazebo at Napili Shores next door. The wait is long for a slightly above avaregae breakfast, but the view and overall experience are worth the time. All in all, this is a very comfortable, very relaxed, and very friendly place to enjoy your vacation. We plan to return and would not hesitate to recommend Napili Point Resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Combo of C37/B37 was perfect for vacationing with the grandparents”
Reviews.Author: JonBird
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this property, specifically in units C37 and B37 which are owner managed. The combination of the downstairs 2bd/2bth B37 (access/no stairs for the in-laws) and the upstairs C37 for my wife, 9 and 12 yr old daughters and myself was absolutely perfect. Realistically, we could have all stayed in either condo as they are both spacious but the additional privacy was great. Credit Patty, the C37 owner, for helping us identify the downstairs condo as well as suggesting we book an additional day to give us a place to relax/change before our 10pm flight back. The C37 unit was immaculate, beautifully decorated and over the top equipped. We wanted a condo so we could eat bkfst/lunch in and Patty has everything you could possilby want, including condiments/spices, dish/cookware, piles of towels. Lots of beach toys/chairs/coolers. Every time we needed something, there it was. Both condos had AC, which was a deal breaker going in, and we never used it as the units set up perfect to catch afternoon breezes. We ran the in-unit washer/dryer every day for swimsuits/towels so ended up not needing much of the clothing we brought (Patty even provides the soap/dryer sheets). Resort is on right on the cove which provided snorkelling with sea turtles (more than I can count), most of the fish we saw at the Maui Ocean Center and darn scary looking eels. We could see the turtles from our balcony throughout the day. Tide pools on the north tip of the property provided great morning exploration and a short but rocky (too much for my cane toting M-I-L) path lead to Napili Beach which was beautiful and great for the girls to play. Between actitivies and amenities, we could have spent the entire week in Napili and been very happy. Did our shopping at Napili Market just up the road (loved Maui Taco's fish tacos in same plaza; snorkel equipment rental at Snorkel Bobs) which had everything we needed. The Sea House and Gazebo restaurants on Napili Beach were both excellent. Overall, we all agreed it was one of the most relaxing enjoyable vacations we'd had. The condo played a large part as didn't need to organize ourselves to get out for breakfast, could pack/take lunch with us and everything was so close that it was just a quick jaunt back for forgotten items or a quick shower/nap before dinner. Really couldn't have been easier. Highly recommend the resort and of course C37 has to be one of the better values there.

Reviews.Title: “Serene and enchanting”
Reviews.Author: Jeriwilliams
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose here over a big resort. We are right on the water at half the price of a "mountain view" at one of the big resorts on Kaanapili. We watch turtles from the lanai, snorkel whenever we want just outside the room, walk to great restaurants, and short drive to Lahaina. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “C21 is a great value”
Reviews.Author: princepaddy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two weeks at Napili Point, Maui. This is one of our favorite places in the world. We have stayed at several condos surrounding Napili Bay and the "Point" is our favorite. C21, a two bedroom unit was perfect for the three of us. The owners have kept the price very attractive while maintaining a quality unit. A plus is that they live nearby if there was an emergency or need of any kind. We will definitely be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the best location on Maui”
Reviews.Author: S&S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 11 days at Napili Point in Maui. We rated it overall as very good so I would say this is a positive thumbs up review with a few suggestions. The highlights: The view is gorgeous. The proximity to the rocky cove for snorkeling is perfect and you're guaranteed to see turtles snorkeling there (although it's not for ocean novices as the entry is a bit challenging but pretty easy if you've snorkeled before.) The tiled pool is also nice and right on the ocean for the great views again (the pool was very chlorinated and yet still needed some minor tile repair and cleaning.). We rented 2 units and we would definitely recommend one of them - C11 a two bedroom. It was nicely appointed in an Island style. For those unfamiliar with Napili, this is a more laid back side of Maui so if you want "resort" style this may not be for you. Some suggestions and concerns: The biggest issue we had was with the other 1 bedroom (B16). It was not as updated and had serious problems with the refrigerator (which the manager tried to blame on us despite our explanation that we hadn't touched it and if it was so touchy why not give us instructions.) We lost a lot of groceries and had no use of that refrigerator for 36 hours. This was not compensated but should have been. In general be aware that these units don't have air conditioning. We probably would have been a bit more comfortable on some hot September days but that's a personal choice. The walk to the beach is not as quick as I expected given the other reviews here. It's a bit of a trek of about 10 minutes and you have to figure it out on your own at first. Luckily there are many friendly neighbors to help. It can be a bit laborious with kids, probably not an issue for just a couple. Again this is not really a resort. It's a set of personally owned, apartment-styled condominiums. If that's what you're looking for then Napili Point is a good option. If you want a resort style locale, Napili Kai may be a better choice (although may be pricier) or head to Kaanapali or Wailea. We enjoyed our stay in beautiful Maui and will definitely be back to Napili.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful sunsets”
Reviews.Author: 2retired49ers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Napili Point Resort the first week of September. We booked a one bedroom with an ocean view. We were given keys to one of the "B" units. It was very nice, but the view was looking mainly at the bay. However, we decided we preferred being closer to the point and ocean. The manager was extremely nice and gave us a couple of condos to consider. We picked A-7 which turned out to be fabulous. We could see the ocean from inside the condo and hear the waves crashing on the rocks at night. Since we were on "California" time the first few day, we would get up early and watch the moon set into the ocean. We also loved the beautiful sunsets and watching the sea turtles in the bay. This complex isn't a resort with fancy pools. It's quiet and has lovely grounds. The condo we stayed in had a nicely equipped kitchen, and a comfortable bed. There are barbecues located throughout the complex. The staff was helpful, especially our housekeeper, Arlene.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo rental on the water”
Reviews.Author: rlewan
Reviews.Content: Napili Point Resort is a condo facility oriented towards rentals. All the units are ocean or bay front. Ours was a first floor unit on the cove facing west. Great sunsets and views of the turtles that live in the cove. The unit was clean, well decorated and the staff kept it up very well. The grounds are beautiful and offer ocean front walks right off your lanai. The office people were very helpful and curtious. You can take a short 5 minute walk to a very nice beach on the sister property next door. The area is not crowded and convienient to amenities and Lahaina. We loved it there and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Snorkeling on Maui Right Out Your Door”
Reviews.Author: Soggiorno
Reviews.Content: This is less a "resort" than a condominium with private ownership of the condos themselves. You can rent through the office or through the owners. I've stayed twice, a week at a time each, and enjoyed it completely. Each place has its own kitchen, which can keep costs down. Ours was a one-bedroom with a king sized bed, and a fold out couch in the living room. The "resort" has two pools and very easy access to the shallow bay, where I snorkeled daily, seeing everything from turtles to dolphins. There is no restaurant, but there's a good one next door, and you're only a few minutes from Lahaina. Some of the condos/apartments are better equipped and maintained than others, but they all seemed fine to me. The maid comes daily.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, but know what to expect for accomodations”
Reviews.Author: SWML-OC
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Napili Point Resort and it's the location that keeps us coming back. We reserved through the resort office the two previous times, but took our own advice (see previous review dated Aug 22, 2010) and reserved directly from an owner, unit C16. Although the name of the complex is Napili Point RESORT, it's really not a resort and if a luxury resort with many ammenities and 5 star accomodations is what you are looking for, then this isn't the place for you. If a quiet oceanfront complex with an amazing view and in our opinion the best snorkeling spot in Maui just steps from your door is what you want, then look no further. All of these units are individually owned and vary drastically in upgrades and cleanliness,but unit C16 is probably the most upgraded and best unit in the complex. Unfortunately even this unit has some areas of opportunity. For one all of the windows and screens throughout need repair. One screen was completely off laying on the floor and a couple of others would barely stay on allowing bugs and geckos into the unit. It actually became comical how we had a nightly routine of trying to get the geckos back outside. We also had a pretty severe issue with ants from the first day we arrived. The unit owner Ann was great and very responsive in getting an exterminator out to the unit within a couple of days, but we still had to use Raid and keep all of our food in plastic ziplock bags. In addition the hot water during showers was minimal so two people could not take a shower at the same time in the two seperate showers and you had to wait after someone took a shower for more hot water to be available. This unit has a washer and dryer which was very convenient as well as everything you need for cooking and even chairs, umbrellas etc for the beach. We aren't sure if we will stay at Napili Point Resort again when we return to Maui, but if we do C16 would be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “They think of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Communicator
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed in C37 at the Napili Point Resort and were very pleased with the accommodations. The condo was spacious and comfortable with a well-equipped kitchen, great beds, large lanai and many extras, such as, snorkeling equipment, beach toys, DVD's, games, books...We had a very nice view of the ocean, the amazing sea turtles and the well-kept grounds. The condo was in a great location with our favorite beach at Napili Bay being just a short walk and the crowds of Lahaina being a 20 minute drive away. There was also an outstanding restaurant, The Pineapple Grill, a mile down the road. When we return to Maui, we will be contacting Patty, the owner, who was an amazing host.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our second stay at Napili Point!”
Reviews.Author: idontemail
Reviews.Content: We loved Napili Point so much on our previous trip that we booked it again this time around. It was myself, my husband, and two teenage boys. We booked a one bedroom and asked for a "ground" floor so we could just walk out on the grass and drop into the cove to snorkel, and this is what we got. It was just great. The one bedroom is big enough for the four of us (kids slept on pullout couch), though I wouldn't call it spacious, but we wanted to be on the frontline and it was worth it. The room had everything we could need including beach chairs, boogie boards, snorkel gear, noodles, a fully equipt kitchen. There were so many turtles in the cove, it was just amazing. I had plans to visit other parts of the island, but mostly ended up just staying "home", since the snorkeling is so amazing and the beach next door is just perfect. The Gazebo and Seahouse restaurants next door both serve amazing breakfasts, also. We are already planning our next trip in two years and will definitely be visiting Napili point again. Oh, and as a side note, I left my husbands clothes in the drawer while packing to go to our next island. I called the next day and they immediately shipped them to the big island for us. Great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area!”
Reviews.Author: jalire
Reviews.Content: These individually owned condos are very quiet. They are on the ocean front - but mostly grass/rocky clifts. Sandy beach is just next door though. It has a small pool, in-room laundry, kitchenettes, nice patio, clean. Loved staying here as oppposed to a large resort or hotel. The coolest part was the cove down below - we could swim with the giant sea turtles every day. No cons to speak of except that some day you will actually have to leave! No restaurant onsite, but the beach hotel next door has a nice big sandy beach and a couple of good place to eat. - walking distance. So close to shopping and other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting!”
Reviews.Author: raider10
Reviews.Content: Napili Point was the perfect setting for our family of 5. We stayed 10 nights in unit C39. We rented from a private owner who uses the on-site management. This includes daily maid service. (VRBO 291983). The unit itself was comfortable and had everything we needed. The wi-fi was a nice addition. Some things in the unit are starting to show some wear, but nothing that would deter us from staying here again. This is a quiet resort with lovely grounds. Beautiful mornings and glowing sunsets to end perfect days! You constantly see people working diligently to maintain and care for the manicured property and pool. Housekeeping personnel was very polite, and we enjoyed our visits with Arlene. Thank you, Arlene for the Aloe plant for our daughterâ€™s sunburn! We loved snorkeling in Honokeana Bay! Could not get enough of the turtles! So much fun to watch. We found a rock shelf that provided the perfect entry/exit into the water. Sometimes easy, sometimes challenging depending on the water movement. Enjoyed walks/drives over to the neighboring beaches, Napili and Kapalua. Coastal Trail was a pleasant trial to take if you want a nice leisurely walk. I had other family members also staying at Napili Point, (B26 & B39). Both parties were very happy with their units. When inquiring about rooms, be sure to ask about air conditioning. Some have it, some donâ€™t. We would highly recommend this resort for those not wanting the to stay Kaanapali. We would love to return here some day!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Great location. Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DaveGoonerGreen
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 - 2 adults and 2 teenage boys. We stayed one week at the Napili Beach Resort. We had a 2 bedroom ocean view condo. The condo was very spacious and very well appointed. The location was great with access to a great beach about 5 minutes walk away and a nearby cove with lots of turtles and fish. There were sufficient nearby shops and restaurants although try to reserve for dinner ahead of time wherever possible to avoid long waits. There is no hotel breakfast! Great view and very quiet (apart from the sound of the sea and birds early in the morning). We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “C-37 Napili Point---Wow”
Reviews.Author: KariMW
Reviews.Content: We spent the first part of the week congratulating ourselves on having located the absolute best place to stay on the island of Maui. We loved every minute of our visit to the beautiful cove, the best restaurants, the swimming beach, the bike path, the farmer's market, etc. This condo was perfect for our family, and I can recommend it wholeheartedly. We were one hundred percent happy with every aspect of our stay. The owner was tremendous. Patty is easy to work with, and made the "business" side of the arrangment absolutely easy. We hope, hope, hope to be able to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: h0rsew0man
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Maui before. Our travel agent suggested Napili Point Resort as a quite, low key condo and he was right. We enjoyed it very much even though the beach is a 5 minute walk away. The pool is set in such a way that it makes you feel like you are swimming in the ocean. If you want to walk to the beach, there is a small general store two minutes down the road which will rent you a beach chair and snorkeling equipment and has limited food items. We enjoyed watching the sea turtles come in in the evening and eat algae off the rocks by the resort. If you go to the beach, you may find yourself swimming with them. We were in B 42. Neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point C37 is an OUTSTANDING CONDO right above beautiful ocean”
Reviews.Author: valeriewallace
Reviews.Content: This is quiet, peaceful, 2-3 story condominium resort, built along and above the beautiful ocean cove of Napili Bay, is absolutely the best place we have vacationed on the islands. These condos were built taking full advantage of the ocean views and accessibility to swimming, snorkling, paddle boarding in the pristine bay inlet below the resort where you can literally swim among the Hawaiian sea turtles. This was a family reunion of 10 days for our three children and their families. We rented 3 condos in the Napili Point Resort and all of us agreed that this resort was ideal: the most beautiful sunrises and sunsets viewed right off all balconies from the living areas designed for this purpose. Just steps from the Bay for snorkling or just swimming in these peaceful waters. A few minutes walk to the sandy beach for swimming, "boogie boarding", body surfing...nice paths for access to these areas as well. Patty Casale's condo C37 was the BEST! This condo is an end unit which allowed the 2 bedrooms to be on one floor with large comfortable living room, amazingly well stocked, up graded and excellent kitchen cooking area (with a pantry full of all household supplies) and amenities galore. Beach toys and boogie boards, beach towels, board games, etc for the evenings are supplied by Patty. The bedroom for the 3 children (two 9 year old twins + a 5 year old child) was comfortable with an extra roll away bed ordered from WILD WHEELS RENTALS to add to the two twin beds already in the room. The master bedroom/bath with king sized bed is great as well. We also enjoyed having the pool for 'after beach' swimming in the afternoon; it is situated between the condos and the ocean, just steps away from Unit C37. Adjacent to the pool on a grassy area directly above Napili Bay is a picnic area with a gas barbecue (ready to turn on for outdoor lunch and dinners) with picnic tables at the barbecue site for amazing dinners right above the ocean. We used the barbecue about 1/2 the time during our 10 day stay, cooked in the nice kitchen for breastfasts, and attended the Hyatt Hotel luau and dinner in Lihana a few nights as well.Grocery stores & restaurants are all a short drive from this resort. Thank you to Patty Casale, who helped us find two other rentals from owners for the rest of the family, and who is just a very kind, helpful and thoughtful individual. We all would definitely want to return to this excellent resort for another Maui vacation. Valerie Wallace

Reviews.Title: “The sea turtles rock - as does the setting”
Reviews.Author: AgentSmithDC
Reviews.Content: This modest, family-centric condo complex overlooks a terrific snorkeling spot. The sheltered cove is home to a large colony of sea turtles that have become accustomed to scores of daily visitors. An added bonus is an abundance of colorful and diverse coral, and the requisite small reef fish. The turtles are out all the time, but look for them feeding along the rocky shore in the evening â€“ itâ€™s fun to watch them get jostled by the waves as they gnaw on the mossy rocks. The accommodations are a great value considering the spectacular setting and the snorkeling paradise. We were in B19, a ground floor one bedroom with beautiful views. It was comfortable and clean with good appointments and a nice bed. Hereâ€™s the downside â€“ with no air conditioning, you hear everything nearby because you have to keep the windows open. The bedrooms of most units front the parking lot, so you hear all the car doors slamming, the chirping horns from the remote locking of car doors, people talking, etc. The good news is that it quiets down by 10pm. Another annoyance â€“ the sprinklers go off during the night and, with the windows open, cause a racket. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and the restaurant next door is great for your first night in town. There is a market just 2 minutes by car or a 10 minute walk. Mama's carry out is there - the ribs are mediocre and not worth the money. A full grocery is about 10 minutes away, an Pizza Paradiso is there - a much better bet than Mama's. Read â€œMaui for Dummiesâ€� and bring it with you â€“ we found it to be invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Christine628
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth time staying at Napili Point, and we will return. We stayed in beautiful two-bedroom, two-bath unit C-22, completely remodeled and well-appointed. We love the quiet Napili area of Maui just south of Kapalua, it's the perfect launch point for our adventuring and relaxing. The view from our room was stunning, we counted up to nine sea turtles at a time in our bay, where there is wonderful snorkeling. If you want a bustling resort where you will be pampered and catered to, this isn't your place. If you want a low-key condo in a gorgeous setting, this may be your place. Note: In all our previous trips to Maui we skipped the Gazebo restaurant breakfast in the adjacent resort, not wanting to spend a minute of vacation in the long line, thinking the famous banana-pineapple-macademia nut pancakes surely were over-hyped. They are not. Get in line at 7 am for the 7:30 am opening, the pancakes are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our room at Napili Point (C-37)”
Reviews.Author: fiddledog
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Napili Point in room C-37. Our room was very clean and spacious. It was decorated great and we could see turtles swimming in the cove any time we stepped out on our lani. This unit was a little bit closser to the main road than I thought it would be and I was a little concerned the road noise might be a downer but that never bothered us a bit. We can"t wait to stay here again. Patty was great to deal with. We were so impressed. The only problem was we didn't stay long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: pdempsey1097
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit C-25 from May 31-June 9, 2011. There were at least a dozon turtles in the lagoon, we had to be careful not to bump into them. We also saw several large Morey Eeels and lots of fish. The unit had a King bed downstairs for my wife and I, as well as twins upstairs for our 14 and 13 year olds. The kids enjoyed the free wifi and cable TV (although not until after sunset - our rules) We really liked the fact the unit had a full sized washer and dryer, snorkel gear, and boogie boards - we used all of them. The on-site gas BBQ's saved us lots of money on dinners out, and we met several very nice owners who made great suggestions about local activities.

Reviews.Title: “simply gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Laurengm
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui in April with our two girls (ages 10 and 6). We especially loved quiet, beautiful Napili Point Resort, where we spent our first five nights. The view from our ground floor condo (A20) was just stunning, overlooking the turtle cove surrounding by flowering bougainvillea, and with a plumeria tree (perfect for climbing) in full bloom just off our lanai. It was the perfect place to start our trip as the girls woke up at 6 am the first morning, ready to explore, and all we had to do was walk out our front door! We didnâ€™t mind the 5 minute scenic walk to the sandy beach at all, as there were interesting tidepools to explore along the way. Plus, we got to swim with turtles in the cove! Compared to the generic high rise condos we saw elsewhere on the island, Napili Point Resort felt very intimate and unique. The unit itself was very tastefully done, with island style wicker furniture, making us feel we had truly arrived in Hawaii. Having a blender in the kitchen and a washer & dryer in the unit were definite plusses. Our only negative was that the swimmign pool is small and chilly, perhaps not the best for families who want ot spend a lot of time by the pool. But our kids didn;t mind, as they were more interested in the beach anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Napili point-lovely, will return”
Reviews.Author: carolann1234
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked unit C-40 at Napili Point through VRBO( # 192602). We found the unit clean , well-furnished and more than ample room for the two of us. The loft bedroom was large. The main floor bedroom was also a good size, with each bedroom having its own bathroom. The lanai had a gorgeous view of the pool, grounds and ocean beyond. We saw turtles every day in the cove, watched them through binoculars from the lanai and then went into the water and snorkelled with them, Getting into the water from the rocky shoreline is risky and not for everyone but it was worth it. Turtles everywhere. The condo was well stocked and we found the property grounds clean and well cared for. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Stairs to get up to the condo and stairs to get up to the loft bedroom may hinder some but we loved this condo and would stay here again, no question. A short walk to lovely Napili beach. A weekly "meet and greet" Mai Tai party is a nice way to meet some neighbours.Daily maid service a nice touch. There are many units at Napili Point to choose from..we liked the nice views offerred from this top floor unit. Renting unit C-40 at Napili Point was a great choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point C37-A Bit of Heaven On Maui”
Reviews.Author: lprill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Unit C37 in December 2009 and counted the days until we returned in April of 2011. Fifteen months was too long to wait to enjoy once more this wonderful Maui Home. I use the term "Home" because the owners have taken great lengths to accomodate their guests with every comfort imagineable. From the well equipped kitchen right down to CD's, beach equipment and a "Where to go and What To Do Guide" there is nothing anyone could want for. We loved going to the Fish Market and the Farmers Market (food is great) and took advantage of the subperb view by dining on the lanai. The location is especially convenient to Lahaina and the ride North of the condo is not to be missed. I have been to Maui many times and will return again, but won't look any further than C37! Aloha doesn't get any better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: Paiasurfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 bedroom, unit C5, a point oceanfront unit. You can't beat the location!! We traveled up and down the northwest coast to most of the beaches and didn't find a better beach than Napili Beach just north of Napili Point (a very short walk). The Ritz beach is a close second but the Napili Beach has the right mix of surf, sand and beauty! The cove right next to Napili Point is the best snorkeling in the area. Sea turtles everwhere! Very much enjoyed watching the humpbacks breach (during sunrise and sunset) from the privacy of our own lanai. The resort is very well kept. Unit C5 was great, clean and up to date. I do think the quality of the unit does vary so if you're unhappy I think your can opt to move into others that are vacant. The grounds have many, clean grills that are great to cook from right next to the ocean. Our favorite day trip was to Paia with pizza from the Flatbread company. Great food and cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at Napili Point Resort C37”
Reviews.Author: Piko2000
Reviews.Content: We were so fortunate to have discovered Patty and Bill's beautiful condo (C37) at Napili Point Resort. We were looking to try a new area on Maui, having always stayed south of Napili on previous trips, and were intrigued by the Napili area. This thoughtfully appointed condo has everything you need: a beautiful location, with a wonderful view of Honokeana cove, the ocean, and Lanai and Molokaii. The cove itself is remarkable, with at least twelve turtles as residents, easily viewed from the wrap- around lanai, where we spent time every morning and evening. Snorkeling with the turtles was amazing; each seemed to have its own â€œhomeâ€� in the reef, and we visited them daily. The condo itself was perfect for our extended family of three adults and two â€œtweenâ€� cousins, with a large master bedroom/bathroom suite and a second bedroom and bathroom. Patty has obviously put a lot of work and thought into this condo: thoughtful touches are everywhere, e.g. numerous hooks in the master bathroom for hanging up wet bathing suits; a pair of binoculars, two binders full of DVDs, for kids and adults, as well as three drawers full of travel books and paperback novels of all sorts. The second bedroom had lots of snorkeling equipment, sand toys, and boogie boards, which was perfect for the kids. The kitchen and pantry were especially welcome, stocked with all manner of dishes, glassware, cooking tools, etc, and well as a spice cabinet, oil and vinegar, and lots of other â€œingredientsâ€™ you might need, saving you from buying something for just one meal. The living area was very accommodating, with plenty of seating, including a comfortable sofa, which converted into a comfortable double/?queen bed, which was used by one of the kids. The condo is a corner unit, with sliding glass doors and windows on both corner walls, so the lighting was beautiful and bright, but could be closed off at night with heavy, rich dark drapes. And beautiful Napili Bay itself is right next door to this complex. We spent many hours there, snorkeling, boogie boarding, and we even rented stand-up paddle boards from Snorkel Bob's at Napili Bay, all within easy walking distance to the condo. So, thanks Pattyâ€¦we really enjoyed our stay, and hope to be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: DonnaandGene
Reviews.Content: The views from the front room and upstairs loft were amazing!!! The condo was comfortable with everything we needed and more. There was laundry detergent and condiments in the kitchen--how lovely. Ellen and David were helpful, informative and delightful. We enjoyed snorkeling with the turtles and walking to the beach on the other side. A very important aspect of our stay was the security and quiet we enjoyed. We came to relax and have a peaceful stay which was exactly what we had, it was heaven. We would highly recommend this property and hope to return. We recommend Drums of the Pacific Luau if you haven't made reservations far in advance because you can purchase VIP seats so that you can sit upfront. VIP tickets are very expensive, but if it's special to you as it was to us because of our 5 year old grandson, they are worth it. Old Lahaina Luau seats according to the date you reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Unit C37”
Reviews.Author: lmswat
Reviews.Content: What a great place with an amazing view! All the comforts of home with better weather and a beautiful view of the cove, ocean and whales!!!

Reviews.Title: “Life doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: palmtrees4ever
Reviews.Content: Napili Point was the answer to our winter getawayâ€¦with lots of sun, 80 degree weather and amazing ocean views! The accommodations at C-20 exceeded our expectations as it provided everything we needed and so much more! We spent hours relaxing, snorkeling and watching the turtles, whales, surfers and the beautiful sunsets from our lanai! With the Gazebo Restaurant and macadamia nut pancakes next door -- life does not get any better than this! We look forward to a return trip for more R & R!

Reviews.Title: “C-37 â€“Â A perfect place to celebrate my 50th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: Keely218
Reviews.Content: When I started planning my 50th birthday celebration in Maui, I imagined staying in a spacious condo where I could relax with several of my friends. C-37 at Napili Point was exactly what I had imagined! Comfortable, quiet, great views and spacious. We relaxed at the pool every day and practically felt like it was our own, private paradise! We snorkeled in the cove with the sea turtles, took the short drive to Kaanapali or Lahaina every evening for dinner and shopping, spent a day at Kapalua Beach right up the road, watched the whales from shore every day and ventured out on a whale watching trip one morning to see them up close and personal! C-37 had EVERYTHING we needed to make our stay comfortable, including snorkeling gear and beach chairs! I can't wait to bring my husband back here someday!

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point C-37 Owner owned Condo”
Reviews.Author: KJHSantaFe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amazing trip to Maui with my partner and my parents. We stayed in this lovely condo that was incredibly well-equipped. The views from the wrap around second floor lanai were amazing. We could sit out with our morning coffee and watch the sea turles in the bay below and whales breaching and blowing. The condo is clean and comfortably furnished. The owners take great care of it and are very responsive to their guests. There is amazing snorkeling nearby. There are several really great restaurants just minutes away. We all loved our stay and definitely want to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Could we ever be there long enough?”
Reviews.Author: Digigammy
Reviews.Content: Our second year at Napili Point. Totally pleased with accomodations, location, ambience, neighborhood and comfort of 18 day short term living experience. Nice walking to Kapalua Beach and beyond, and other nearby spots. Beaches, restaurants and entertainment near by and within walking or driving. Nice pool and comfortable lanais for outdoor living. Whales were spectacular and along with surfers and turtles were viewed from lanai. All units are ocean front with unobstructed views. Love the roar of the ocean waves.

Reviews.Title: “Snorkeling and sunsets best on the island”
Reviews.Author: Swimgirl1962
Reviews.Content: Although not "plush", the rooms are clean, updated with tile and granite, stocked with everything you need. The view of the ocean and sunset right out our window was wonderful. No crammed in hotel feeling ~ the grounds are green and well-kept. We watched whales from our porch in February right off the point. The walk down to the beach along a lava rock path often has turtles along it, and Napili Beach is as good as any beach we drove to on our vacation. The little protected bay right next to the property provides a snorkeling experience that rivals (or bests) the snorkeling we paid for ~ even off Lanai in the preserve! You routinely see dozens of turtles just inches away from you ( you have to try to avoid them often) and every type of beautiful fish we saw anywhere else. You have to work a little bit to get in and out on the slippery rocks, but well worth it, even for our 7 year old! The unit had a noodle which made for longer snorkeling. Our maid was very sweet and accommodating, and there were fun activities with live music and chances to mingle with the variety of guests this place attracts ~ older travelers, honeymooners and families with younger kids. The kitchen and community BBQ's let you save on food costs, and there are convenient markets in the area. If you are looking for the fancy resort vacation with attached shops and restaurants, this isn't it. If you are like us and like to spread out with your family in your own area, enjoy snorkeling and a beautiful beach a small walk away, and have a clean comfy base camp from which to explore the island, this is perfect. Great value and we will definitely be back with our teens.

Reviews.Title: “This is why we like Maui!”
Reviews.Author: ks_h9308
Reviews.Content: Once you've been to Maui, you want to go back again and again--so we have, 15 times. Once you discover that Napili has the perfect mixture of views, activities, peacefulness, and access to Maui's best (restaurants, golf, shopping), you want to go back--and we have, 12 times. Napili Point is our favorite spot in Napili, and B-4 is our favorite unit. It's been recently renovated and redecorated completely, and the owners really care that you have a great experience--furniture, appliances, even artwork are all 1st-rate! You'll read other reviews about the great location, snorkeling, staff, and beach nearby--combine all that with a well-appointed, luxurious 1-bedroom condo with arguably the best view in the world! We missed the whales when we were there in September, but the turtles, occasional dolphins, and constantly-changing eastern shore of Molokai kept us entertained! We've already scheduled our next 2 trips back.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Accomodation in a Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: jamesco34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fhoughtfully equilped condo from Jan. 31, 2011 to Feb.7, 2011. The weather was beautiful and during our stay we experienced snorkeling with the green sea turtles in the nearby cove, a trip on Hiway 30 to the East coast to view the blow hole, whate watching and wonderful meals at nearby gourmet restaurants. The hostess left nothing to chance. It seemed there was almost two of everything in the way of utensils and appliances. A closet pantry contained abundant provisions, "goodies" and cookware. The condo had a spacious lanai overlooking the nearby cove and watching the sunsets in the evening was especially enjoyable. Our hostess called during our visit to insure our well beiingl. All in all, it was a most pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, good service and facility.”
Reviews.Author: MNFamilyTravelersUSA
Reviews.Content: Napili Point is built right next to an awesome private little bay that 99% of tourists do not know about. Most tourists go to Napili Bay which is the next bay north of this one and a short 5 minute walk away. You can sit on your patio and watch sea turtles constantly in the bay. You can see whales breeching from your patio as well but you need patience as they are a little tougher to spot 1/4-1/2 mile out to sea. Yes, entering the water to go snorkeling here is a bit tricky but definitely doable. If you are elderly or not real physically fit, or if the waves are high, I would suggest walking next door and entering there like others say. I am 40 and my kids are 10 and 12 and we had no problem the 3 days we went snorkeling. The condo (B-20) we rented was not brand new or anything but was just fine. If you want something nicer, then go spend $400 a night at one of the newer condos or hotels down by Kaanapali. We rented from the management and had no problems checking in or out. We had maid service daily just like a hotel with new towels, beds made, and the place picked up just like a hotel. We probably paid 5% more by going through the management instead of direct to an owner, but heck it was definitely worth it. There is a small grocery store(bigger ones in Lahaina), a Maui Taco, and a Snorkel Bob's store all very close to Napili Point. We stayed in a B level condo. It was very close to parking lot plus no steps at all. If you want closer to the water, then go down some steps to A level. If you want 2nd floor with nice view and steps, then go with C level. They are also ranked by Ocean View(back of bay, Ocean Front(middle of bay) and Ocean Front Point (100% right on ocean). Their website shows you exactly where the units are. I would definitely go back and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Unit C37 is Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: mmfurbee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Napili Point unit C37 several times with my family. I used to stay at the Ritz or the Westin, but found this condo much more comfortable and homey. It's like having your own home in Paradise for a week. Patty, the owner is VERY helpful and informative. Everything that she said and what I saw on the website is accurate, if not understated. The comfort and cleanliness were what really stuck out in my mind. The decor and furniture are like new and is done in a tasteful tropical motif. The master bedroom is roomy and the king bed and bed linens are of excellent quality. I slept like a baby! There is a large closet and plenty of drawer space. There is a vanity and sink outside of the tub and toilet room. There is also a nice size safe in which to keep any valuables. The second bedroom is also a nice size with 2 twin sized beds, which can be moved together to make a king, if desired. The closet in this bedroom is the fun one! It has snorkeling equipment, boogie boards, and lots of fun things, which saves the time and expense of going to the beach shop to rent these things. The kitchen is probably, no it IS, better equipped than my kitchen here at home. Every gadget imaginable, lots of pots and pans, dishes, glasses, spices, teas. We did not have to improvise for any thing. The great room is the best! The couch becomes a very comfortable sleeper. REALLY! At night when you have the doors and windows open, you can hear the gentle pounding of the surf as a gentle breeze blows thru the unit. If you are lucky enough to be there during a full moon, you will see it shine across the cove and see the shape of the palm trees blowing in the wind. It is breathtaking! For those of you who need more entertainment there are plenty of VHS tapes and DVD's to be viewed on the large screen TV. CD's to enhance the mood and Internet service is free for those of you who just can't leave it behind. If you still have doubts about being in Paradise, step out onto the lanai that wraps around the unit. The view of Lanai and Molakai across the waters of the Pacific is exceptional. If you happen to be there during whale season, you will be able to see them cavorting in the near waters. But the absolute best, as far as I'm concerned, is the cove just off to the left side of the property. Every morning and evening lots and lots of huge sea turtles come into the cove to feed. When snorkeling in the cove, you are guaranteed to see them. Look down into the rocks where they sleep during the day. I can't say enough about my stays at this condo. I will just tell you, that before I book my air fare, I always check on availability of Unit C-37 first because I wouldn't stay anywhere else! Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: 77seattle
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this resort in January 2011 and we had a very bad experience. For nearly $400 a night we expected more than subpar, dirty accommodations, broken appliances, a dryer vent that vented into the condo, blown fuses, delayed responses from management and no rudimentary maid service. We understood we were to get only basic maid service, but every day we were there we had to go ask for new towels from housekeeping and/or management . Most of the time the front desk personnel dismissed our inquiries and requests with " we'll get to it" and they rarely did until the morning of our last day when we made a complaint. The only positive thing about the place was the view from our deck. Watch out for bugs in the kitchen, too!

Reviews.Title: “Treasure in Maui”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost two weeks. The cleaning staff was great. Our location was unbelievable. It was a treat to be so near the water and see sea turtles and whales from the pool area. Our condo (B34) was very nice, but we didn't stay there much. But you could hear the surf clearly in the whole condo. Napili isn't the most central location to see the whole island but driving with Maui scenery wasn't bad at all. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Snorekling at Napili Point”
Reviews.Author: bobs1961
Reviews.Content: For all you snorkelers having trouble getting in the water at Napili Point. Simpliy walk down the property toward the back of the bay. Walk over to the other small resort located in the back of the bay. Go to the south end of the that property. Enter the water there through the resort. The water is only a couple of feet deep then gradually gets deeper. I have been doing this for years when the bay gets rough . Its not a bad walk and nobody has ever given me or my kids a second look. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation Location”
Reviews.Author: goadyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Unit C25 with spouse and 2 friends. Couldn't ask for a better location right on a great snorkling bay and literally minutes to a great beach. The view from this unit was beautiful and at this time of the year whales could be seen frolicking in the ocean with Molokai and Lanai in the backdrop. The unit was clean and sufficiently appointed to make our stay a pleasant and comfortable one. I would not hesitate to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point C37 Your home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MJR4
Reviews.Content: Napili Resort C37 is an outstanding choice for a family vacation. The peaceful location, wonderful amenities, and beautiful views make for a lovely vacation. The two full bedrooms with very comfortable beds create privacy for four guests. The unit is fit with all of your needs. The nearby supermarket makes it easy to cook in the unit. Enjoy all the comforts of home while away from home.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Location, individual units vary dramatically...”
Reviews.Author: JMax100
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Location right on the ocean. Quiet. Not a party place...which was positive for us. Specatular views, sunsets, great snorkeling with the turtles, Napili beach just a short 4 minute walk away. Surf was up out front.. very entertaining. Units vary dramatically. Some units renovated, some not. Some have air conditioning, some not. We looked at three units on arrival. Staff was excellent, professional. We stayed in unit A-13. This unit not renovated, but clean, nice bed, well equipped with lots of extras ...beach chairs, towels, boogie boards, stacks of books even snorkel gear. Obviously thoughtful owners. Enjoyed several rounds of golf at Kapalua. Sampled several restaurants in the area (Merrimen's, Duke's, Pinapple Grill, Sea House...all pricey, but first class) Don't miss - the Gazebo on the beach next door for breakfast... We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: ScooterScantland
Reviews.Content: Hi my family recently spent 10 nights in unit C37 and had an awesome holiday. Patty(the owner) was very helpful and their condo is just like a home away from home...It was very well equipped with everything we needed for our holiday(snorkel gear,boogie boards,kitchen has everything u could possibly need)Condo was clean and everything is like it is described on the website. Snorkeling in the cove was awesome!More fish than Molokini!Turtles were everywhere...sometimes there were so many we had to get out of their way! It is only a short walk to Napili Bay which is one of the best beaches I have ever been too! We will be returning to Maui in the future and will stay here again Travis

Reviews.Title: “Great time Maui-style!”
Reviews.Author: Nick911
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Napili point resort in unit B37 with family (they had the unit above us, C37). As each room is different and owned by individual owners, there will be differences in the rooms, however, I can say that B37 was in my opinion one of the best spots, being close to the pools, snorkling, and parking.
