The room itself was recently renovated, clean, open, spacious, and of course ideally situated in the resort. It was stocked with everything we needed, and the welcome basket with local chocolates, chips, and candy was a nice touch! As for the resort, wow, what a spot. Literally steps to world-class snorkling among the Hawaiian Green Turtles, and a local surfing hot spot. Having gone in the off season, it seemed like we had the place to ourselves, most times being the only ones snorkling, the only ones in the pool, or, the only ones at the barbeques. There were even full-time security guards roaming the grounds. Location: literally steps from snorkling, surfing, and prime turtle watching (whales too). About a 5-minute walk (scenic) to the beach. 5 minute walk to the Gazebo restaurant for amazing pancakes or omelettes in the morning. Easy to find, about 10 minutes from the Lahaina Cannery Mall. Lots of parking, easy to find, and quiet. Grounds: immaculately maintained, pools were vacuumed every morning, grounds were well groomed and kept. Clean throughout. Desk staff: did not have much dealings with them, but all seemed to be well, there seemed to always be someone there. By my estimation all units would have a pretty decent if not great ocean view. There are many resorts in the area, all seem to be nice, however, we certainly had no complaints with this one, and would certainly return. To do while in Maui: 1) Rent a convertible. We had one for our 10 days and didnt regret it for a second! 2) Go see the blowholes! 3) Do the road to Hana, while there, dont forget the blacksands beach (there is a trail to the left as you face the ocean which brings you down to some pools which you can jump into and swim under the rocks). Also, past Hana are the 7 Sacred Pools, this is a must do! Climb up behind the 2nd waterfall from the top, and take a jump off the top down into the cool pools below! 4) Eat at BubbaGump's Shrimp! 5) Check out the Aquarium! 6) Go snorkle at Molikini (we used Four Winds charters and had a great time). 7) Drink a local-made Mai Tai! 8) Walk the strip on front street in Lahaina! Feel free to message with any questions. N

Reviews.Title: “Location Great! Condo not so...”
Reviews.Author: ajtoo
Reviews.Content: This is no fault of the Napili Point Resort. We did VRBO (vacation rental by owner). We will never do that again. There were so many issues with this particular rental and we had no recourse. The condo we stayed in was not well maintained, broken appliances,missing and broken utensils, ants crawling in the bed in the masterbedroom (we are fully aware of the ants in Hawaii, but this was overwhelming), worms in the shower and torn, shredded curtainsin the living area. We ended up sleeping in the loft with the twin beds. Be forwarned, before you do a VRBO, make sure you personally know the people who own it or have rented it. We have contacted the owner and informed him of the problems, so I will not give the room number as he may not have been aware of what was happening on his property. This may have been the first time anyone has let him know. Hopefully, he is taking care of the problems. Now for the good stuff! The Napili Point Resort is on one of the most beautiful coves in Maui!. Sea turtles, manta rays, Humuhumu......., eels, Just gorgeous! The sunsets were fabulous. Difficult getting into the water, as it is very rocky, no beach. Napili Bay is 5 minute walk. It's not particularly easy to get to as it too, is rocky and can be slippery. You can walk next door and go through the public accsess to reach it. A very nice beach! The Gazebo restaurant is on the property next door. You will wait for seating. Food is okay, don't really know what all the hoopla is about. Nice food, nice staff but not super stupendous. Much quieter area then Kaanapali, so if you're into nightlife, this is not the place to be. We did have a wonderful time and have put this condo experience behind us. This was our fourth trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point is the best location on the West Shore”
Reviews.Author: Olowalu
Reviews.Content: Napili Point Resort unit C21 is beautifully updated and has every amenity and comfort of home. Private, quiet and the BEST turtle snorkeling on the island. Fabulous sunsets every night and beautiful rainbows in the morning. This location is also very close to the best beach snorkeling spots on the West side. Thank you for making our vacation week enjoyable and relaxing. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Maui”
Reviews.Author: joeandnatalia
Reviews.Content: This was our second vacation at Napili Point . Last year we stayed at C-20, and this year C-25. The condos are perfect for a relaxing stay in Maui. Incredible views, and convenient location just 5 minutes north of Kaanapali . Just a short walk to awesome napili beach, and the cove where we snorkeled with the turtles every day! Condos are fully stocked with everything you need, including snorkel equipment boogie boards and a blender for pina coladas! If you like golf, Kapalua is 1 minute down the street. This place is like a slice of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: frodaness
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Unit C-20 at Napili Point, WOW, it was amazing! the owner was very prompt in answering any questions we had before and after our stay there. the view from the balcony on to Honokeana Cove was awesome- at any moment we were able to see turtles coming up for air and the sunrise and sunsets were spectacular. snorkling was literally a minute or two walk down some steps and the swim beach (napili bay) was less than a five minute walk away. we definitely recommend this place and would return! if you want to have a fun and relaxing time in the sun and water, this is the place to be. ahhhh, paradise, we didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: SWML-OC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day vacation at the Napili Point Resort and you will read the same thing from every other reviewer, the location is beyond amazing. However, it's our opinion that because the location is so amazing, others have been inclined to be less critical of the actual accommodations. Since for us there is nothing more frustrating than planning a wonderful vacation and then being very disappointed with where you're staying, especially for 10 days in the same place, we will provide as much specific detail regarding our unit as possible. The best advice we can give is to plan way in advance, 6-12 months at least, and do a lot of research on the individual units. All units are privately owned and vary DRASTICALLY in upgrades, ammenities and cleanliness. Some units can only be rented through the actual owner and others through the main office. I asked at the front desk during our stay what units have recently been upgraded and the only information they were willing to provide was to ask for a recently upgraded unit when you make your reservation and they will "do the best we can to accomodate your request when you arrive". The front desk also discouraged against renting directly through an individual owner because according to them, "you will have no representation on the island if you have issues with the unit", since the front desk does not support those units. They also stated that they have minimum requirements of the units they rent and home owners who rent on their own "usually don't meet those minimum requirements". Well, we asked for a recently upgraded unit when we made our reservations and were still not completely happy with the unit we were given, unit #C12. We even looked at 2 other available units when we arrived and they were not nearly as nice/upgraded as #C12. We looked at unit #C26 and #C7. Both were not appealing at all due to the lack of upgrades. Although #C7 is an ocean point view with a simply incredible, unobstructed ocean view that goes on forever. #C12 is an upstairs unit with one bedroom and a loft. The downstairs bedroom has a queen bed and the upstairs loft a king bed. Both beds were not very comfortable, especially the upstairs king which was hard as a rock. This unit is next to the pool and the balcony overlooks the pool area. This was one of the reasons we originally looked at other units when we arrived. It ended up not being a major issue since there never really were a lot of people at the pool and we were gone most of the time during the day. At night there never was anyone at the pool and we left all our windows open all day and night without being bothered by noise. The kitchen is pretty large compared to the other two units we looked at and the counters had been upgraded to granite and fairly new cabinets, along with the counters and cabinets in both bathrooms. The living room and dining area furniture also looked liked they had been upgraded not long ago. Other than that, the rest of the unit was outdated, old and not very clean. The day we arrived we made lunch at the unit and wiped down the kitchen counter with a damp paper towel and the towel was black from dust and dirt. We understand that this is a tropical area and the windows are typically kept open all day, but we would expect that on our first day of arrival the unit would have been thoroughly cleaned prior. We also found the same to be true of both the bathroom counters. Neither of the bathrooms were very clean, including dirty fingerprint smudges all over the upstairs bathroom wall, grime on the toilet seat lid and mold in the showers to the point that we stood on a hand towel while showering, so our feet wouldn't touch the actual grout/mold. The upstairs toilet was loose and wobbled when used and the tile around the toilet was broken/missing a piece. The more we looked around the unit during our stay, the more we noticed just how old and unclean the unit actually was. The housekeeping staff was very nice, especially Ilene who typically cleans this unit, but when they clean they do a very quick job and not very thorough. The front desk staff who were working the day we arrived, were also nice and allowed us to look at the other two available units to compare. The cove that these units border, is the best place to snorkel of all the places we tried during our stay, but as others mention it is very difficult to get in and out of. All in all, we would definitely stay here again because of the location, but will take our own advice next time and really do our research on what unit we stay in.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: George812
Reviews.Content: We are grateful to those who wrote reviews for this resort and once again we made an excellent choice in staying in this resort. The seaview is fabalous and we enjoyed the sunrise and sunset. And on the last day of our stay, we saw a rainbow in the sky. The room is big and well equipped. We cooked and had every necessary utensil. The service of the resort was great and attentive. We were given key to another room to wash our clothes when we informed the staff that water leaked from our washing machine. We enjoyed all the facilities in the resort. The swimming pools were clean. The BBQ sites were clean and tidy. We were particularly pleased with the Monday party. In the party, we tasted the best Maui gold pineapple. Really hope we own a room of this resort and stay there any time we want.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Napili!”
Reviews.Author: turtle047
Reviews.Content: We chose the Napili Point Resort based on the reviews here on the TripAdvisor, so we thought it fitting to offer our own recommendation as thanks. This resort is fabulous for those wanting a private, quiet vacation in a beautiful, oceanfront setting. We spent a week on Maui, travelling the island extensively: Wailea, Kihei, Lehaina, Kaanapali, Kapalua, as well as taking the gorgeous drive to Hana. After viewing the Ritz Carlton and the Four Seasons and the various resorts in Kaanapali, we didn't see any as appealing as the Napili Point Resort. The resort itself is very attractive and well kept and because it on a rocky point, and not a beach, it is quiet, which for us was a big plus. The main attraction, though, is the location -- right on the water. None of the big-name resorts offer this. If you have teenagers who want action, Kaanapali may be your best bet, but Kaanapali and Wailea, for our tastes, were too commercial -- highly manicured and overly developed. An added bonus was that Maui was fairly quiet and prices are discounted. The only line up all week was at the Gazebo restaurant on the property next door and at the Sansei Restaurant in Kapalua. Otherwise, very easy to get around and do things. We stayed in Unit B1, with an ocean front view. Excellent view and nice accommodation. The bed, however, was very soft and should be replaced soon! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Napili”
Reviews.Author: dsa
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a week at the Napili Point resort. The location can't be beat - the units all look out over Honokeana Cove and the ocean beyond and as advertised, is around the point from the Napili Bay beach. The snorkeling off the point in the cove offers easy access and lot of fish and turtles. The clarity isn't quite as clear as what we found off Lanai (we took one of the snorkle boat trips as well) but the variety of fish and convenience of snorkeling right in front of your condo was terrific and the water was still quite clear. Many sea turtles to see regularly - we were told they show up primarily in the mornings and late afternoons but we saw them out there any time of day. The unit we stayed in (C-21) was in their ocean front category. We looked at a couple of different units and found that they do vary. This one had an upgraded kitchen and comfortable furnishings. Not luxury but tasteful and completely adequate. The manager was agreeable to our looking at a couple of available units before we decided which we wanted - I recommend doing this if the unit you are given isn't what you expected. The first unit we were assigned to was in the lower price point category (ocean view), had dated and well-worn furnishings and was in the building closest to the road and noisier than we liked so the upgrade was well worth it. Other units in that building may have had nicer furnishings though and they do offer air conditioning in the bedrooms of that wing to compensate for the road noise if you don't want your windows open. The rest of the complex has ceiling fans and lots of window options which were more than enough to keep the place cool. The pools were clean and convenient. Daily maid service was a treat. BBQ's were appreciated for the times when we wanted to eat in (and the local market at the Napili Plaza had an excellent selection of whatever you might want). We weren't around to take advantage of their weekly mai tai gathering or the pineapple cutting demo but it's nice that they offer these. The breakfast next door at the Gazebo restaurant is worth making time for - and you will need to wait since it's a small place but go in a relaxed state of mind and you'll be set for hours. The portions are huge and it's all so good that we didn't need to have lunch at all that day! (they told us around 11:30 is when the line is the shortest and breakfast is available anytime they are open).

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: WDCAT4
Reviews.Content: After a very crowded and busy 4 days on Waikiki, we wanted something peaceful and quiet, yet close to some fun for our family of 4 (children 18 and 21). This was absolutely perfect. Rented unit C-16 from Ann Stark (on vrbo.com) and absolutely loved this condo. Sits right on Napili bay with amazing snorkeling. Beautiful marine life everywhere and the turtles (which you will see every day) are unbelievable. Napili beach is a short walk away and is absolutely beautiful. We prefer less crowds on beaches and this place was simply perfect. 10-15 minute drive to Kaanapali and Lahaina where some great food and shopping are. Can't say enough about this place. Was slightly concerned about reading there was no air conditioning (I am always very warm) but the constant breezes made this very comfortable. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: marina_from_belgium
Reviews.Content: I stayed in B-26 for 10 nights with my husband and two young boys ( 3 yrs old and 6 months old). It is privately owned, rented through www.VRBO.com, if you want to get better rates, dealing directly with the owner. It was great, absolutely beautiful. The other reviews are accurate (turtles, sunsets) just email me if you have specific questions, and look at the pictures, it is beyond beautiful. You can save yourself some bruises by entering/exiting the snorkel bay through the next door property.

Reviews.Title: “C-37 No Ka Oi!”
Reviews.Author: jjansen041
Reviews.Content: My family and I (husband, mom, and 3-yr-old) just returned from Maui, and Napili Point Resort C-37 was such a wonderful place to stay! It's a 2-bedroom (full bedrooms, no loft like other 2-bdrm units in the complex), 2-bath, and includes everything you could posibly need. We had a really wonderful time, and the condo was a big part of that - we could watch whales and beautiful sunsets from the lanai, we did some excellent snorkeling in the cove right outside, and of course just a short walk to gorgeous Napili beach. My son just LOVED the pool with the "pretend turtle" at the bottom. The condo was so well stocked and well cared for, it made for a lovely place to come home to at the end of the day. We went to Duke's at the Honua Kai resort for my mom's birthday dinner, and it was fabulous! Highly recommended! My husband and I also had a wonderful date night at Merriman's in Kapalua. Unit C-37 is rented privately by the owners, you can find it through a google search.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: lschaaf
Reviews.Content: We had an great stay in privately owned unit C-20. We were traveling with our two daughters who were 9 and 10 and wanted them to have a bed to sleep on, not just a pull out couch (though there is also a pull out in this unit...plus a queen and 2 twins). It was clean and well stocked w/amenities, plus convenient to everything. The other great thing was lots of towels, we had towels hanging to dry everywhere (though there is a washer and dryer, didn't want to waste energy), but always could find dry ones to take to the beach or use after a shower. While the condo had everything we needed to be comfortable, our favorite part was the location. My husband tried out every other bay on the west side that was suppose to have "the best" snorkeling, but it really was right outside our window! We talked about going out and renting snorkel gear for the week, but when we got to the condo, everything we needed was there (we brought masks from home for the girls, but there were plenty of fins for all and masks for my husband and myself. There may have been more masks, I didn't pay attention!). There was a boogie board to take to the beach (Oneloa Bay was our fav boogie boarding place, just north of Kapalua Bay). Besides snorkeling and body surfing, other super fun things we did, bike down Haleakala Crater w/the Heleakala Bike Company (had smaller bikes for kids, ride down at your own pace...that's the way to do it!) and surf lessons at Goofy Foot in Lahaina (so much fun!!!). We definitely will recommend staying at Napili Point Resort C-20!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Napili Point!”
Reviews.Author: Michiganbeachl0ver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 9 wonderful nights at the Napili Point Resort. We stayed in a one bedroom unit (B39) and absolutely loved it! After reading reviews of the resort on trip advisor, I thought it sounded exactly like the kind of setting we would love, quiet, private, and away from all of the hustle and bustle. We weren't disappointed!! Our unit was gorgeous, with a beautifully renovated kitchen (nice cupboards, granite counters, dishwasher), and was fully equipped with everything we needed. In fact, we cooked all but one of our meals in. There was a nice large flat screen tv in the living room, and one in the bedroom, too. The bathroom was large, had a really nice vanity (two sinks, a luxury for us!) and granite counters, as well as a nice ceramic tile walk in shower. The entire unit was very tastefully decorated, including gorgeous water color paintings by the owner. We loved sitting out on our private & roomy lanai watching the whales spouting, and also loved snorkeling in the bay with the sea turtles. That was a real highlight of our trip! It was really tricky getting into the water from the slippery rocks, and even harder getting out of the water! I had a scary moment trying to get out, and kept getting knocked against the rocks by the waves (I've got a mean looking bruise to prove it!). The only negative to the unit we were staying in is that the bedroom is right on a fairly busy road, and the traffic would wake us up before 5:30 each morning (including loud delivery trucks). we tried shutting the bedroom window and having the a/c on, which helped block out some, but not all of the noise. There are three buildings comprising Napili Point Resort, and ours was the only one right on the road. So, if you are not a really sound sleeper, this may be an issue. We really want to stay here next year, but will try & get a unit in another building (too bad, because we just loved everything else about B39). We asked the front desk if we could see another unit, so we could compare what others looked like, so we can get a better idea of what to book next year. Not sure of the unit #, I think it was B29. We really didn't like this one. The kitchen cupboards looked really cheap, the decor dated, and the carpet (we had nice new ceramic tile thru out in our unit) was musty smelling. I would have been really disappointed if we had gotten this unit. If you want to get away from all of the business and crowds of Lahaina and Kanapali, Napili Point is the perfect place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Family vacation, memorable resort, perfect.”
Reviews.Author: MonDuke
Reviews.Content: Our trip was our first to Maui and we selected Napili Point Resort based on information from a friend who had only seen the resort. We took a chance and it was the perfect choice. We had 2 of the 1 bedroom oceanfront units (B10 and B11). My husband and I in B10 and my Daughter, Son-in-Law and Granddaughters in B11. Both were very nice with B10 being most recently updated. We were steps from the pool and had a beautiful view of the Bay. The youngest on the trip snorkled many times in the bay and saw many types of fish and all the turtles. It was great fun just watching the turtles from shore. It was a short walk to the sandy beach which was beautiful. The resort was beautiful and very quiet and laid back, far from the rush at Kaanapali or Lahiana. The only problem I had was sleeping through the noisy early birds chirping outside our windows. But that is what you get being so close to natures paradise. The Gazebo Restaurant next door had the best pancakes we have ever had. They were worth the wait. This was a family trip of a lifetime and the Napili Point Resort was a big part of that. We can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, the pool looked like...”
Reviews.Author: probowl803
Reviews.Content: Great place, the pool looked like something out of that cocoon movie. Didn't know this was a older persons resort so beware . .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View, Beautiful Place to Relax!”
Reviews.Author: rkmartin7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit C-41 it was a 2 bedroom unit that was updated and decorated nicely with everything you need in the kitchen. Only suggestion would be a flat screen TV in the master bedroom in the loft other wise it has everything you need. We really enjoyed the pool, the views of the whales from the Lanai and watching the turtles in the cove. Snorkeling in the cove the week we were there was a little rough the ocean didn't cooperate very well so the visibility wasn't as good as I had hoped but we did get to see turtles every time we went in. The entry/exit for snorkeling is defiantly a little challenging especially for the kids (ours were 7 & 9). We really enjoyed going to Napili Bay for the beach. The Gazebo is worth the line you have to wait in for breakfast - I'm not a fan of pancakes but they made me a convert with the White Chocolate Macadamia nut pancakes. It's nice that you can run in to Lahaina for dinner if you want to and it only takes about 15 minues. It is a long drive if you want to drive to Hana or Haleakala we did both and plan on a full day for each with drive time etc.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point - Great Views - Snorkeling entry is tricky”
Reviews.Author: KenTennis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit B-9 in Napili Point thru VRBO. This 1 bedroom unit was very nice, very well stocked, the view was beautiful. The living room and bedroom had ceiling fans, and the unit had great cross ventilation. We paid about $210 per night, a very good value. The owners who live in Hawaii were great to deal with. There were some very nice snorkeling coves at the Napili Point but entry and exit were tricky. You had to walk across some lava rocks barefooted and slip into the water. This was no problem for young surfers with tough feet, but the rest of us got in the car and drove to a snorkeling location a little easier to get into.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Relaxing vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: EmmySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napili Point, condo A-2 and had the best vacation ever. We watched whales breaching, dolphins jumping and turtles swimming right from the comfort of our lanai. This condo is so ocean front that if you were any closer you would be swimming. The condo has everything from boogie boards and beach chairs to washer/dryer and flat screen cable TV. Beautiful golden sand beach 150 yards away and great snorkeling right there in the cove. I highly recommend this unit - private and classy.

Reviews.Title: “Snorkeling with Sea Turtles right outside your lanai!!”
Reviews.Author: Nailhammer
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Napili Point Resort. We have been to Hawaii many times, usually on Oahu--but this was by far our most enjoyable trip. Our condo-C11 could not be beat! Ocean front, pool front with awesome views. You can sleep at night to the sound of the waves. Our unit had been renovated which was great. The owner provided beach chairs, boogie boards,current movies, etc. For a family-this is the ideal set up. The beach is a quick 5 walk down a path. (the condo sits on a rocky shoreline) The sea turtles are in abundance in the bay in front of the condos and snorkeling is awesome! We didn't snorkle anywhere else on the island because it was so great (not to mention) convenient, right in front of th condo! There were about 12 sea turles, 2 eagle spotted manta rays and an abundance of fish. (these were the regulars that we could see everytime we jumped in) You are not allowed to touch the turles, but they are so friendly, that you can get right up to them and watch them eat and swim around. In fact, I was get ting into the water, dipped my face in and got quite a surprise as there was a giant sea turtle literally inches from my face! The bay is calm too, so you can take little kids out on a boogie board and just let them snorkel by dipping their face in!! The hotel also had a free mai tai party on Monday with entertainment which was nice. Dec/Jan rates are high, $450/night-but I reallythought the location couldn't be beat. The owners were great with communication and even sent us a packet with restaurant./shopping recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “THE VIEW AND LOCATION SAYS IT ALL”
Reviews.Author: thebestholiday17
Reviews.Content: WOW what a trip !!!!!!!!!!it's been a while that we stayed in a condo instead of hotel rooms and what a condo C37 was , it was fantastic the view off of the lanai was incredible ,at one point we could see 8 sea turtles sunning themselves , the bedrooms were fantsatic , very comfortable master bed . we didnt have to buy any water toys or snorkel gear as the closet was full of it ,just a short walk to beautifull napili beach and we were set . now the coolest for us was the kitchen !! , it was full of all our cooking needs we shopped a lot at the napili market and safeway and the outdoor barbecue by the pool was very handy ,the location being close to LAHAINA was the best part as a lot of our activities were just a short drive ,(as well as the shopping ) I WILL BE BACK !! THE LEMIEUX FAMILY , PRINCE ALBERT ,SASK , CANADA

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and condo with only a couple of suggestions”
Reviews.Author: joannalex
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at C-25. The location was just what we wanted. We didn't have to drive to do any of the snorkeling or boogie-boarding that the kids wanted to do. Honokeana Cove is great for children since you don't get much wave activity and the turtles are fabulous. Bob gave a lot of thought to this unit and supplied it with beach chairs, snorkel gear,boogie boards, books and movies. All of the extras made for a really nice stay. The condo was clean and up to date. The addition of a second bathroom was nice with 5 of us staying there. The only thing we had trouble with was the soft mattresses and would like to see those updated , along with a bed that doesn't squeak. I would still highly recommend this unit and this condo. We would definitely stay here again! The last recommendation is that if you are eating in, and everything you need is there for this, get you groceries at costco or the safeway in Lahaina. I hope your experience is as good as ours was!

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation yet!”
Reviews.Author: fromWItowarmthplease
Reviews.Content: Our group of 16 people -ranging in age from 6 to 70- found Napili Point to be incredible. We had four rooms, each with a fantastic view. Someone from our group went snorkeling in the cove every day, and we saw turtles every time. The water is clear and beautiful, and the turtles and fish make this snorkeling experience better than the $95 snorkel trip we took. The beach at Napili Kai is accessible, but having it a little further down the shore was great, because it provided some peace and quiet at the hotel. The beds were very comfortable, even the pull-out couches. The farmer's market and the Napili Plaza being so close was great, and we went to both multiple times. We had a mix of home-cooked meals, eating out, and take-out. The kitchens were equipped well enough to cook for all of us, but the proximity to great restaurants had us eating out a lot. This hotel helped to create a truly unique experience that all of our group will remember for a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “I almost don't want to recommend this resort to you...”
Reviews.Author: HiCarolCo
Reviews.Content: ...because it was so perfect, and I don't want it getting all crowded up and overbooked when we can finally return! We had a terrific time here -- snorkeled with the turtles & fish daily. There were family members who wanted the sandy beach w/ breakers -- done. There were folks who were fascinated by the tide pools -- done. We have several artists in our group and they found plenty of fodder (even in the parking lot fauna!). There were some of us who snorkeled 2-3-4 times per day just to see the fish, coral, and turtles again (and I loved the sand-free experience of that). Tomorrow will be a sad, sad day -- I won't be able to step outside my door and step into a pristine aquarium moments later. Our unit provided boogie boards. No aircon was needed, since the fans and ocean breeze kept us perfectly cooled (but not cold). The kitchen was fine for our needs. We were all (16 of us) able to gather on the lawn and at the pool(s). The resort was a short walk to many great dining spots (Sensei, Sea House, Gazebo) and just a short & easy drive to other great beaches & sights. The staff was helpful and responsive (though we didn't really want for anything while there). I cannot wait to go back -- take anyone (including young kids and not super-strong swimmers) to snorkel out into the cove with you and be amazed. The only tricky part is the first time you get in and out of the water on the rocks -- after you find your method, it's a sweet, protected, wonderful place to see Hawaii's shallow-water marine life.

Reviews.Title: “unit c-20 great Cooking Kitchen, Huge TV and Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: loves2golfStl
Reviews.Content: this owner did a great job of accommodating families by stocking a great kitchen with spices and pots you can even boil pasta water in. Some fins and snorkels are provided and binoculars to watch whales, dolpins and turtles. Golf and scuba zip line hiking are easy to arrange, (we like ed robinson) but the set up of the condo is what makes it all work so well. Three TVs' one a huge HDTV--

Reviews.Title: “Not So Quiet Resort”
Reviews.Author: JJTwice
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to stay at Napili Point Resort for some relaxation-forget it. We have stayed here over the years and usually run into the same stupid problems but this year we've had it. We stay in the B units and THERE IS NO CHANCE TO SLEEP because they are not insulated well enough and they put us below a family-so lots of noise. AND we like kids-so we don't blame them. Even if you check in and it's quiet-they eventually will put someone above you who will keep you up. The C units are above us and you can hear every foot step-very poor insulation-sounds like no carpeting at all. The A units don't have enough cross ventilation. There is no air conditioning in any of the units-so sunset time is very hot! Today they are repairing some unit-this usually happens somewhere in the plan-even though they know that this is one of the busiest times of the year and they should plan repairs when there are not so crowded. This year they also repaved the parking lot-if you know Hawaii, parking is very limited-so again-inconvenience. You can't beat the view and I believe that this is why they get booked-but if you can't sleep what's the point. You are too tired to do anything. We plan , in advance, when we come here-so once again, their complete indifference as to where they put you is unbelieveable. I suggest that they put families together- not around couples who want to relax. Just poor front desk etiquette-AND indifference. If you complain-YOU HAVE TO MOVE and the change is to a much inferior unit. No wonder Hawaiian travel is down -the aloha spirit does not exist here! I watched an older couple check in and ask if they could see the ocean-the wife could not walk very well. The next day, the husband had to move because they could not sleep in the unit-one of many things wrong with it-and they could not see the ocean very well. Since you are so close to the ocean-you get lots of surfer traffic and the parking lot is monitored but you get surfers taking the parking spots anyway, I hope this resort gets exactly what they want-no visitors-because that is exactly the feeling that you get.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderdul Resort”
Reviews.Author: JS2323
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a week stay at Napili Point and couldn't be more happy with our visit. The rooms were clean and kept cleaned by the daily maid service. The location was quiet but close enough to more lively areas. The pools are great for kids and the bay is wonderful for snorkling. Turtles seen daily just be patient when looking for them under water, they are there. The beach is clean and great for kids. Wave sizes tend to change from minute to minute, always be careful with small children. The path to get to the beach is rough if you do not have good eyes or walking abilities, but the good part is you can drive and drop off anyone just down the road. We plan to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Every Day is a Great Day!”
Reviews.Author: TheMaynardsArizona
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit C-40 and found it to be a very special place! It had the best view of the ocean and we could see the large sea turtles swimming in the ocean from our living room and balcony as well as dolphins. The snorkeling was superb because it is located just outside this unit in a calm cove and the giant sea turtles are friendly and abundant. The decor is beautiful and the furmiture is laid out in a functional manor for convience. I love some of the items such as the parrot lamps. The kitchen has eveything that you could want to fix a meal or barbeque. Many resturants are located within walking distance on a trail along the beach .My favorite place to eat breakfast "The Gazebo" was a short walk. Morning walks or jogs were beautiful around the grounds of the Ritz Carlton and Fleming Beach. The beds were cozy,comfy and everything was clean. Can't wait to back to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo!”
Reviews.Author: smith6173
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in Condo C-25 and this place was perfect for kids. The cove is home to about 15 green turtles and we snorkeled with them each morning. There is a great beach just steps away. The sunsets were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “great value and what a view!”
Reviews.Author: johnbobOregon
Reviews.Content: stayed in B21 and were really pleased with quality of accomodation. The location is wonderful,snorkeled with the turtles every day from right infront of the condo,bbq'ed every most evenings and enjoyed the fabulous sunsets. Helpful staff,and just the right of amount of peace and quiet we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “"Look at the view but don't look under the mattress"”
Reviews.Author: sesko
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Unit C-3. Here's the good: Beautiful view. Nice condo. Great snorkeling. Safe swimming beach area. Here's the bad: Bedbugs. And lots of them. We went home with over 75 bites between us. I would recommend this hotel but bring your own mattress....

Reviews.Title: “Unit C-37 at Napili Point is the best home away from home!!!”
Reviews.Author: graciejeff
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here from July 2-10, 2009. It is a very clean, inviting and comfortable two bedroom/two bath condo corner unit. It has a great wrap around balcony that has spectacular views of the bay where turtles are swimming constantly. The kitchen was stocked with almost everything that you could imagine. We felt right at home. There are fans in every room and the bedroom with twin beds has a wall air conditioner which was very nice to have! The owners are very accomodating and pleasant. Everything they said was accurate! Napili is a ten minute drive from Kaanapali and a very quiet and relaxing place. If you want a lot of night life this wouldn't be the place for you. We enjoyed the simplicity and peacefulness of the area, the spaciousness of the bay and the nearby beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect appartment for a perfect stay - go A-15”
Reviews.Author: RodBor
Reviews.Content: Before our trip to Hawaii we have spent hours trying to find best places to stay in the web. But main problem is that feedback does not seem balanced, as naturally more unhappy people like to share their experiences. So, we have decided that we will choose an accomodation with which people like we are (family with two kids looking not for cheapest bargains but for good value, clean place and friendly service) had been happy. We have decided for Napili Point Resort for Maui. And, that was one of our best vacation decisions. The location is unique: sea turtles waiting to snorkle with every day - the entire day, great sunsets & views from your own little terrace. The service people have been not only friendly but committed to make you happy. It is not a 4 or 5 star hotel service, but coming from the heart. The garden and pools are well maintained (7 days a week). And the appartment? Well, that depends on which you pick. During our stay we have met people who changed theirs after one night to move closer to the sea or needed more space. We have not met any who had not been satisfied by the cleanliness or condition of the furniture or installations. We have made the best decision, we could: We booked A-15 directly via the owner Burt. we could not only access additional pictures, we had the guarantee to get, what we have selected. And, from the point of time of our booking, Burt took care of us. Long before our trip he has send kind emails providing us with good information about the place, the typical weather, what to pack etc. And when we have arrived and opened the front door, we felt so happy: The appartment was even better then it had appeared on the photos. Very new, very tidy, high quality kitchen, TV, stereo,...simply all you need (incl. body boards for kids!). Tx. Burt for providing us a place that made our holidays very special!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hawaii Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ldtolson
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in Unit C-25 in June and had a fabulous time. We had an ocean front remodeled unit and could sit on the lanai and watch the turtles in the cove below. I loved the modern granite kitchen and new bathrooms, but our kids loved the big screen HD TV in the living room. We spent many days at the nearby beautiful Napili Bay beach. But the best thing was snorkeling in front of the unit. We saw turtles, coral, and many different brightly colored fish. The Gazebo restaurant was crowded but worth the wait. We went out to dinner a few nights but mostly just stayed at the resort and barbecued and enjoyed the sunsets. Donâ€™t miss the sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point C37-Excellent condo, location, views and turtles.”
Reviews.Author: themenz
Reviews.Content: This particular unit gets excellent reviews for good reason. Very clean, very comfortable for 4 adults. The people were friendly, most kept to themselves. It felt private and was soooo relaxing! Let's start with the important stuff. Location and views. Napili point is about 45 minutes from the airport, although this can be a slow drive during rush hours as much of it is single lane. There is plenty of parking. The units are labeled A, B, C. This is a C unit that has two bedrooms on the same level which we liked. Most C units here have a loft as the second bedroom. C-37 is also located at the end of the building so it enjoys more windows and cross ventilation--very important. This unit is elevated and has a wonderful ocean view from the living room and especially from the large wraparound balcony. We saw two full rainbows from the deck.The cove where sea turtles surface and eat is maybe 50 yards away as you look across one of the pools. The location is quiet although the bedrooms in the back are located about 50 feet from a small road. This cove, called Honokeana Cove, has very, very good snorkeling. It is almost entirely protected from the surf and is often glassy smooth. Many sea turtles any time of day from smaller to 4 foot giants. Lots of colorful coral too but not a ton of fish. Water visibility was fair to good while the water temp in June was about 80 degrees or so. Also there is great snorkeling a few minutes up the coast at numerous sites including Slaughterhouse Bay. There is also a nice sand beach about a 5 minute walk north if you want to sun bathe and do a bit of splashing. Very nice for children as the waves aren't too big. Also at the the next door property is the "famous" Gazebo restaurant. Nice views, good food, big breakfast portions (easily shared), but expect a 20 minute wait at almost any time, except near closing. Decor/Amenities They have nice furniture that is functional and comfortable. The king sized bed in the master was very comfortable. They normally have two twins in the second bedroom but they pushed them together with nice pad to make a king for my brother and his wife. Small flat screen TVs in LR and in both bedrooms. Several bar stools at the kitchen counter. In the living room is a larger round dining table that could seat 6 easily. There is one basic chaise lounge on the large deck and a nice patio table set with seating for four. There are some nice pictures on the walls and other Hawaiian objects here and there. There are two bathrooms which are basic and fairly small with a shower over the tub. The master bedroom has a separate vanity sink area while the hall bath has the vanity in the room with the toilet and shower. C-37 is very clean with lots and lots of supplies and a kitchen that is better equipped than my home. Leave your beach towels at home. Before you buy any supplies, check out the spices, pots, pans, silverware, toaster, blender, bottle openers, glasses, etc. in the condo. You will also find lots of different teas, sugars, coffees, filters, etc. Good size locking safe in master bedroom. Internet is $10/day with a break for a full week. Wired and very fast. Air conditioner in second bedroom which we never used. The tradewinds of 10 to 20 mph were blowing all the time after 12 noon or so. The unit was very comfortable with the windows open. Nice quiet fans in every room kept the air moving too. I did not use the pools but my wife said they were pleasant. Only one umbrella so bring your sunscreen. We barbecued at one of the many gas grills and they worked well and were clean. There are picnic tables so enjoy your meal oceanside. Tips: Do yourself a favor and shop at the local market in the shopping center about 5 minutes away. You can walk there but the road is very tight with no sidewalk, kinda tricky. (C-37 has an insulated wheeled shopping cart and nice canvas bags to carry groceries.) Very decent prices, nice selection of deli stuff and great meats. Prices there compare well to Safeway which is 20 minutes away. Rum was actually less! Another tip. Buy your roasted chicken at this market rather than at the chicken and ribs place next door--about 1/3rd the price! There are more turtles in this cove than you will see on the snorkeling cruises. Save your money unless you must snorkel Molokini. Bring some good open shoes like Teva's for walking to your snorkeling in the cove. The lava can be tricky and flip flops can be problematic. There are a few smooth easy places to get in and out depending on the tide. If you want really easy access to the cove walk to the next property south and they have a cement ramp with a bar that you can hold onto while adjusting your mask or putting on your fins. Also, wear a dark T shirt while you are snorkeling. It prevents sunburn on your back, shoulders and keeps you a tad warmer. I use one that is synthetic as it dries faster. Buy some spray sunburn protection and be sure to apply to the top of your head. Why? When you lie in the water, a large round spot on your head will not have any hair covering it. It will get fried after 20 minutes in this tropical sun.

Reviews.Title: “Snorkling with the turtles”
Reviews.Author: KauKauLauLau
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed in a condo before, so were very pleased to find that the unit we stayed in, C-11, a two-bedroom with a loft, was not only clean and well-maintained but had even more comforts than our own home. There were board games for the youngsters, CDs for all PG viewers, enough kitchenware to make gourmet meals and a view to die for. Each morning we would wake up and rush to the lanai to count the turtles in the cove below. With the coffee pot brewing (Maui coffee of course) and waffles in the toaster, the kids would help us plan our Maui day (which most often started with a snorkle right outside in the cove. Hint, that's free!) While we were out, the housekeeper tidied up and when we got back, we were able to wash all our beachwear in the big washer and dryer. (We had been advised not to bring beach towels since the resort provided them, and they did.) Parking is free in the lot outside. This particular unit has a lovely garden master suite overlooking banana palms and orchids. Since it is on the second floor (the buildings are only two-floors) the window looked out on palm fronds and greenery. While we didn't stay much inside, the unit has a modern kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, full-size refrigerator. Countertops are granite and the cabinets are white beadboard. We were told it is one the the nicest units in Napili Point (not all of them are modernized.) There is no air conditioning but since the nighttime temperatures were in the mid to high 60s, the ceiling fans kept the place cool. We parents liked the loft bedroom for its privacy and view of the ocean. We put the kids in the closed-off mainfloor master suite so we could put them to bed early and enjoy the rest of the evening to ourselves. Other family members stayed in other units, but as they say we think C-11 was the best. (We booked through the owners on their website. I know I cant give you the website address since Tripadvisor doesn't allow it. But it is ".net" if that helps.) If you are looking for nightlife, Napili Point isn't it. But for honeymooners and those with families, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “C37 is "Home" - not just a condo!”
Reviews.Author: TNGranny
Reviews.Content: The owners of C37 at Napili Point in Maui know exactly how to make a guest feel comfortable. From the Bath Basket in the Master BR, to the labeled and well-equipped kitchen, the CD and DVD selections to the Guide Books, the comfortable decor and the closets full of beach equipment, everything one needs but a bathing suit has been provided at C37. The maid service was excellent, the location perfect - out of the way of bustling Ka'anapali - Napili Point is close to excellent Restaurants and convenient groceries. The view of Molokai and Lanai from the lanai is superb - and the whales and turtles were right there for our entertainment. In Maui, you don't want to be anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: beavermom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 night stay in unit B-10 at Napili Point. Though it was spring break, the complex was uncrowded and very peaceful. The unit had one bedroom and one bathroom with a pull out sleeper sofa for the kids. It was recently remodeled with a nice kitchen, everything we needed for cooking was provided. There is no air conditioning, but we did not need it as there is a wonderful breeze that blows through the unit and keeps it quite comfortable without the noise of an air conditioner. What we loved: The location was wonderful, with a beautiful view of the ocean. The unit is located right next to one of the pools, which made it nice as I could watch the kids swim while I made dinner. The patio of the unit is surrounded by a hedge, which makes it much more private than most of the other units in the complex, so we could eat dinner without people looking at us while they walked by. It was extremely quiet and peaceful, very relaxing. The unit is clean and well cared for. There are several b-b-q grills that overlook the ocean, which made cooking dinner enjoyable. The snorkeling in the bay was fantastic, without a doubt the best snorkeling on the island. In the afternoon when the wind pick up on the rest of the island, the cove is still very calm and we were able to snorkel until sundown. This complex has a very reasonable rental rate, which includes a compact car. We found it to be a great value. We liked the fact that is was a quiet complex, there was no crowding at the pool, often we were the only people there, (no throwing towels on lounge chairs at 5 AM like at the Marriott). What we did not love: The bed. It had a pretty big mountain in the middle, and it needs to be replaced. Also, it had a waterproof mattress cover on it, which felt like we were sleeping on plastic. I would really recommend that the owners replace the bed and get rid of the waterproof cover, it is crinkly and uncomfortable. Overall impression: Nice, quiet complex. If you have the type of family that likes to relax and does not need constant entertainment from an activities coordinator, this is a great place to stay. If you are looking for a water park with slides, a pool side bar and an attendant to bring you drinks with little umbrellas, this is probably not the place for you. This is our 10th trip to Maui, first time staying at Napili Point. We have stayed at upscale resorts, other condos and hotels, but the entire family all agreed that this is our new favorite spot and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay! C37”
Reviews.Author: June1999
Reviews.Content: Our extended family of 6 rented our 2 bedroom condo, unit C37, directly from the owner. Her website helped us in the planning process showing us video and still pictures of the unit. One of the great things about renting from the owner were all the "extras" already waiting for us in the condo. There were tons of plates, bowls, eating utensils, condiments, and dry goods waiting for us. Also they had beach equipment for our use along with coolers we used on our drive to Hana, tons of DVDs and CDs along with lots of books as well. For the next guests we left rum and various drink mixers. Since we were there during â€œwhale seasonâ€� we had the treat of watching the whales from our condoâ€™s balcony. We had binoculars but we could see them clearly without them as well. There is snorkeling cove in front of the condo where the family snorkeled with sea turtles and the sandy beach is a little walk away. Please note the path to the beach is over uneven ground and not fit for strollers/wheelchairs but is a pretty walk next to the tide pools. There are two pools at the property which we used every day. They are medium size rectangle shaped pools with plenty of chairs and lounges. The gas BBQs are located right there at the pool area with a great view into the snorkel cove. The Napili Market is well stocked, decently priced and only a minute or two drive from the condo. We had no problem finding all we needed for our stay. PGA caliber golf 10minutes away in Kapalua and close by in Lahaina as well. The Gazebo restaurant at the Outrigger Napili Shores (next door) has a great breakfast but get there when they open or you will wait. We thougth it was worth the wait--a lot of great food for a decent price. Lahaina town is about a 15 minute drive away with tons of restaurants and shopping. We found a wonderful shave-ice stand right across the street from the free parking lot. I would definitely recommend this property and unit C37 to my friends (in fact I already have).

Reviews.Title: “Relax at Napili Point”
Reviews.Author: Midwestnaturelover
Reviews.Content: We have been to Napili Point 3 times and have enjoyed each visit. The location is great especially if you enjoy snorkeling. The office staff has always been very accommodating and we especially enjoy the friendly cleaning staff. Snorkeling in the bay right in front of the condo is excellent and there always seem to be sea turtles swimming with you. It's also just a short walk to the beach and the Gazebo Restaurant next door which is a great place for breakfast or lunch. We love just walking on the lava rocks and seeing what's swimming in the tidal pools. The view of both Molokai and Lanai is great and in the winter whales are constantly in sight. On a previous trip we were fortunate to see a monk seal sleeping on the rocks. This trip a pod of spinner dolphins entered the bay. The snorkeler's in the water certainly had a nice surprise and it was a treat just to watch them splashing and jumping. We have now stayed in a "C" unit when traveling with our adult children, a "B" unit and this trip we were able to stay in an "A" unit on the Point. All have been nice. The "A" unit was very close to the water and the noise of the waves was very relaxing for us. Sitting on the patio with papaya and coffee each morning while watching the water, waves, whales or surfers couldn't be beat. We're hoping to get back to Maui and Napili Point again soon.

Reviews.Title: “On the other hand...”
Reviews.Author: mmfun
Reviews.Content: I just canâ€™t work up the same enthusiasm for the Napili Point Resort as others. I think it may be because we ended up being sleep deprived. Our bed in Unit A-9 on the point had the worldâ€™s hardest bed. We compensated by putting the sofa bed mattress on top of the regular mattress. That worked, but it was awkward. We had chosen one of the point units to be close to the ocean. It was, and the view is beautiful. Unfortunately, we were there during a very big storm with lots of wind and a booming, crashing surf. My husband had many vivid war dreams. All of the A units are within feet of a well used sidewalk that follows the bay. Since Maui is two hours behind even Pacific Time, new arrivals tend to wake early, and love to walk along the bay with their morning cups of Kona coffee. As they chat, it doesnâ€™t always occur to them that someone else might be still in bed, with an open window (no air conditioning), just feet away. I think we would have been happier if we hadnâ€™t been on the ground level. Our lanai and living room were not at all private. We either needed to be dressed or inside with our curtains drawn. Once we noticed the large family of mice in the underbrush across the sidewalk, I enjoyed the lanai even less. There is no beach, (although there is a rough little path over the rocks and through the weeds to the beach next door), the pools arenâ€™t heated, there is no playground equipment, and no daily planned activities. There is no hot tub, spa, or weight room. There are turtles in the bay, and in better weather, snorkeling. During our stormy week, we could watch surfers at the edge of the bay. Being right on the ocean, we could see the whales. It is a very quiet, laid back resort! I saw many serious readers. It is moderately priced. I understand why others love it, and feel almost guilty saying that, for us, it just wasnâ€™t the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and private”
Reviews.Author: capoeira_girl
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with how nice the condo was, taking in consideration the low price that also included a rental car. We got a one bedroom with ocean view room. There are two choices- 1st or 2nf floor. 2nd floor has a balcony overlooking Napili Bay, and 1st floor has a nice patio. The condo is stocked with anything, and I mean ANYTHING, you can imagine, including books, cooking supplies, dishwashing detergent, ironing board, etc. The area is nice and quiet but within reasonable distance from supermarket and restaurants. The only downsides were little annoying flies and that there wasn't a sand beach near by. To go to sand beach you have to tak a bit of a walk, which is not a problem considering two or even three beautiful pools that are lit up at night time. By the way, the rumor has it the lower pool does not have a surveillance camera installed (hint for the newlyweds) The front office offers all kinds of entertainment. What we liked the most was hiking trip with a great guide(who, by the way gave us a lot of useful info beyond the hiking trip) and snorkeling with the turtles. I highly recommend both, especially the hiking trip. The place is great for honeymooners (for its privacy and beauty), as older couples that are looking for some peace and quiet, as well as families with children. Whether you are looking to go out to eat or cook in the house, you will be comfortable and will have everything you need at hand

Reviews.Title: “Napili Point Resort Unit C-37”
Reviews.Author: robolob
Reviews.Content: Unit C-37. We contacted the owner via their web page --which you can find by googling. The condo was fabulous, well stocked with everything under the sun, and then some. Be sure to check out the entire condo before you go shopping; they have nearly everything you can think of. The view of the Ocean from their balcony was amazing and you could sit and watch the sea turtles in the lower cove. The condo itself has a great floor plan and was extremely comfortable. Napili is close to everything so don't feel that you can't stay here if you fly into the main airport; it's a short 20 min drive!! Have a great trip... We did.

Reviews.Title: “Swim with the turtles”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDevils
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this condo and first I was skeptical since it wasn't in the chic section of Maui but I was soooo wrong. We absolutely loved our stay there. Our condo was roomy enough, 1 bedrm/ for 4 of us and although the furnishings were nothing special and dated, we had the BEST time of all 3 islands because of the fabulous cove that it sits on! Every day, twice a day we would walk down to the water and snorkel with more than a dozen sea turtles and many colorful fish. It was like a private aquarium. After spending days on Kauai looking for the perfect snorkeling off shore, this was fabulous to just walk out of the condo and down the steps. If the agent just said there were sea turtles there in the first place, we would have booked instantly. We will go back and tell all our friends to go there...such a reasonable price and beautiful sunset views!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our vacation in Maui, and our stay at the Napili Point Resort was extraordinaryl! We had a two bedroom unit with amazing views of the ocean and Molokai. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Turtle Heavan at C37”
Reviews.Author: ltldawg
Reviews.Content: I booked a vacation for 10 days through a website for Napili Point C37. Having not been to Maui in over 15 years I based my decision on the website for this particular unit. It is very detailed with pictures and amenity information. The unit by far exceeded my expectations. Although the web site is VERY nice it was even better when we arrived. The unit is very tastefully decorated, felt just like a home, had a fully stocked kitchen and very comfortable furniture. The bedrooms had Tv's and there was an abundant amount of personal VCR movies and DVD's as well as an assortment of cd's to listen to. The lanai looks out over the cover which is stunning at sunset. The unit even had a large variety of snorkel gear and boogie boards so we did not have to rent any. This was the best vacation my family and I have been on. The owners even sent us email before we left wishing us a wonderful time and good weather. One of my favorite things about the location was the beach which is a 5 minute walk, the Gazebo Restaurant( which is so worth the wait) and the snorkeling and swimming with the turtles in the cove. We never had to spend any additional money to go out snorkeling because it is outside your doorstep. I recommend this unit to anyone and can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great remodeled unit”
Reviews.Author: Bogey_8
Reviews.Content: We spent a delightful two weeks in Maui in unit C-35, at the Napili Point Resort. The view was amazing and this two bedroom unit had a recently remodeled kitchen and baths. The location was quiet and the property overlooked a snorkeling bay with views of the ocean and the island of Lanai. We would highly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place for R & R”
Reviews.Author: chicagoaz
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our unit at Napili Point Resort. We were not sure what to expect since I booked a 2 night stay online and was not sure what we were in for. After 1 day we called the airline and car rental company , contacted the front desk and was told we could stay in A-12..... stayed an extra 2 nights. Someday we hope to go back to Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Some A units get an A+, others a B-”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the middle of January though the middle of February. We booked one of the A-units directly through the owner afterreading several offers on line. Since we booked over a year in advance, we had no problems getting the unit we wanted. In fact our unit was guaranteed. There are three categories of A-units: point ocean front (A 1-12); ocean front (A 13-19) and ocean view (A 21-27). The point ocean front units are the most expensive, with view of both Moloka'i and Lana'i, while ocean view units have the lower pool in front of the turtle cove and glimpses of the two islands. The ocean front units, like the one we stayed in, overlook Lana'i and the turtle cove. With only nine feet from the grassy knoll, these units are ideal for lounging, gazing at the windsurfers/surfers and the turtles. If there is any drawback to these units, it's that many people choose to linger in awe of the turtles while standing directly in front of the lanai. There are other units, to be sure. In fact, there are 120 units altogether. B units and C units are located by the upper level but a ways back from the A level unitls. (Photos give the erroneous impression that there are three levels--there are only two). The C-level units are two-bedroom units and are fine for families or two couples. The loft-level bedroom has no door to ensure privacy. Access to these room are from the parking lot only. One must take a connecting path to the pools and beach walk. What I find amazing about the A units is that one cannot hear conversations from inside the neighboring units. Unless a nearby units is chatting outside, these units are usually quiet. Be advised that strollers like to talk and this sound reverberates into the A units. At night, this isn't much of a problem. Outdoor gas grills are spaced apart on the grounds to allow grilling. On Monday afternoons, the management hosts a mai-tai party for everyone. Maids will drop a note to remind guests! Also in the reminder slip is a note that resident Nani likes to "talk story" while showing guests Hawaiian vegetation and also to learn the proper way to choose and cut a pineapple. Check the in-unit reminders for times and location. Why am I giving this property four circles instead of five? Many of the units cater to massive turnover and the units do show wear and tear, although with limited maid service, these are usually clean. Other units are reguarly maintained with their owners constantly updating and replacing fixtures and furnishings. These are ideal units and while small (A units are 600 square feet) they are supremely comfortable. There have been so many fine reports about nearby restaurants that to repeat them would be redundant. The newly renovated Ritz Carlton (Kapalua) has a magnificent $27 breakfast buffet "plus." I say "plus" because the servers will serve oatmeal, fresh mahi-mahi (yes, at breakfast!), and even bowls of fresh berries. I find the quality very high and certainly justifies the high price tag. Besides, this will eliminate the need to go out and splurge later! The Sea House restaurant, in addition to serving what I consider a first-class breakfast, offers a special slack key guitar program on Wednesday evenings. Expensive at $45, it nevertheless presents authentic island music and often features the Ukulele Boyz, an island treasure. (What used to be Fish & Poi at the Island Surf is undergoing a name change; the management has already changed.) A stay at this resort is uncommonly satisfying. I am confident most will find this medium -end lodging worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: norcal777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit C3 which is a 2 bedroom point oceanfront category. Awesome view but I was disappointed in the unit itself. We have stayed in a 2 bedroom oceanfront (C12) and the square footage was greater. When we return we will stay in the oceanfront category. Each unit is individually owned so some have better amenities then others. There were a few things that needed improvement, where the carpet met the tile the carpet tacks were sticking out and actually stuck my friends foot. The blinds in the upstairs vanity are approx 2 feet too narrow. The fridge took a long time to cool off but we put tons of warm sodas and beer in it so that was part of it but the filter for water didn't work either. We don't watch TV on vacation much but there was no TV in the upstairs loft. The bed was VERY firm and was great for me but may not be for others=). The shower in the downstairs bathroom was either firehose or dripping out. Now for the positives...the view was AMAZING! From this unit there was nothing blocking our view of the whales breaching (Nov-Apr). This unit is very close to the walk way that leads to The Gazebo for breakfast (get in line by 7am and they open at 7:30). There was never any wait for the BBQ's and they had gas and coal ones. The turtles are great of course in the cove in front of the condo. Our favorite beach in Maui is the Napili Bay and it's a very short walk approx 150 yards from the door of our condo. On Monday nights they do a maitai party at the pool which is fun. We went whale watching on Captain Steves and it was phenomenal! (6yrs and up) It is a hard bottom zodiac type boat. It was so great I went again while I was there=) and it's only $39 per person. Our friends stayed in unit B28 a 1 bedroom ocean front category which was awesome because the kitchen and tiles in the bathroom at recently been renovated. You could walk right onto the lawn from the lanai which was nice and since it was a end unit no one walked in front of the lawn so it was like an extension of the patio/lanai. The view from B28 was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Gorgeous Views, Relaxing Condo Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Belltravelers
Reviews.Content: When we visit Maui, we prefer Napili for the relaxed atmosphere. We prefer renting a condo in Napili (vs a high-rise resort elsewhere) because: ** Space to spread out for everyone ** Dining Area with full kitchen/fridge for bfast &/or lunch ** Laundry facilities for small jobs in middle of stay ** Separate TV and sleeping areas to accomodate people ** Can get multiple bedrooms in one unit for families ** Napili condos are lower-rise buildings = lower people density, better views, generally more sq footage, quieter & more relaxing Re: Napili Point We stayed for 2 weeks in #C-13, a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit on the top (C) level of the complex. Upstairs bedroom was a loft style area with king bed, & bathroom with shower only. Downstairs bedroom has 2 twin beds & bathroom with full tub & shower. Living area has table 4 chairs, sofa, side chairs. Lanai has small table & chairs, lounge chair & side table. Full kitchen/fridge w/ micro, blender, dishwasher, coffee maker, toaster, etc. 3 full sized closets; pool noodles, in room safe, foam ice chest, and small up/down closet washer/dryer (dryer vents into room... not a problem for us as we did small loads and dried at pm.) Gorgeous ocean views from our condo include the cove just south of Napili with swimming sea turtles, rocky coastline with breaking ocean waves & surf towards Kahana (we've watched surfers & whales & sea turtles on the surface) and the view from the sofa is rather southwestern out to sea and includes the islands offshore. We look through 2 tall swaying palm trees at the ocean below & beyond - just lovely! Outdoor facilites here are well-maintained, pretty pool on B level, mature landscaping, easy parking just outside the entrance to the room (always spaces in lot.) The snorkeling in the cove adjacent (south) to the resort is rewarding when sea conditions are calm - the cove is full of tropical fish & sea urchins of several colors, we saw a large black octopus on the sea floor, many huge sea turtles swam with us throughout the cove, and several small schools of fish resting in the sandy bottom between the coral outcroppings. The rocky area leading into the water could be tricky for young children to navigate - I'd suggest that kids under 10 or so go to the sandy beach just north of the complex and snorkel/play there under adult supervision, as conditions are much safer. There's street parking and a public access area to that beach, including a fresh water faucet to wash the sand from your toes as you depart. We rented snorkel gear from Maui Dive Shop in Kahana Ctr by the week - they even had rental Rx masks for those with glasses; and they were as aloha-friendly as ever! Re interior of #C-13: appliances were ok - newer fridge, older stove/vent/dishwasher, partially working toaster was cheerfully replaced. Air flow was great and high temps were in low 80s; the 2 bedroom units have windows on 2 sides for ventilation and ours had 3 ceiling fans sprinkled throughout. The kitchen could use a re-do as it's tired and the cabinet opening areas are greasy from many years of hands using them; the large bath/tub combo needs to be replaced as the grout is worn, stained & gaping where it meets the tub, with several large caulk patches also gaping; the plastic tub has surface scuffs/crazing; the upstairs shower floor tiles could use a scrubbing with degreaser/soap scum remover; and the ceiling fans need to have their blades thoroughly cleaned (black dirt on edges). The carpets are newer and clean, hard floors are ceramic tiles, wiped clean daily by maids. The upstairs king mattress is old and hard - we bought a 4" foam/poly mattress pad at Costco and new pillows (the ones in the condo are dreadful) - and we slept in comfortable luxury! The resort staff are aloha-friendly and helpful; maid service was delightfully performed each morning. We bought internet access for our room (equipment already in place including connection cables - we plugged in the laptop and voila! connected!) For food = bfast at Gazebo next door & in room (Napili market 3 blocks away; large Safeway in Lahaina); take-away lunches from Mamas Ribs & Napili Smoothie (they have good grilled panini sandwiches) also Subway & Maui Tacos (we couldn't find the fish in their fish tacos) in same Napili Plaza center. Dinner = we were pleased with the places nearby in Kahana Center, 1)Outback was consistently great, and welcomed us with warm aloha our first night after unpacking. 2)Maui Brewing has excellent pork ribs & salads & microbrews & Maui grown steaks; 3)the ice cream shop had terrific island ice cream flavors from a local Maui ice cream co (Roselani?) (lilikoi, coconut, cherry, chocolate macadamia)...there's also a Roys Restaurant & Shell Gas station & McDonalds & Maui Dive Shop in the center. To our delight, we found many excellent, high-end restaurants on the beach for sunset dining in Maui this time... Mala, Pacific'o, i'o, Hula Grill and others in Lahaina. We found Sansei's sushi in Kapalua to be both over-rated & over-priced, even with the 25% discount. We avoided Wailea restaurants because of mixed reviews on this site and elsewhere... and why bother when there are many to choose from in Lahaina/Kahana/Kapalua areas? We also enjoyed Hula Grill's casual Barefoot Bar several times for dinner (live music & hula dancer 6:30-9pm), with validated parking in the whaler's village pkg garage. We used several discount coupons provided by Napili Point's mgmt - kudos to them as they saved us some money and we appreciate it. Would we stay here again? Yes. With kids? - only when they're 10 & up. For families with younger kids, I'd choose a different Napili condo resort right on the sandy beach where the access to the beach & snorkeling is safer. Overall, 2 thumbs up to Napili Point Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Back again and Loving it”
Reviews.Author: breeze_of_wind
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Unit A2, on the point. We have stayed there in the past and the stay has always been a delight, and this was no exception. The unit was in great shape, with relatively new appliances. The views are special indeed -- the two islands, the sunsets. Turtles were in the bay, and the Napili and Kapalua beaches retain their charm. We spend most of the time at Kapalua, sitting under a tree, snorkeling off the beach, and having fun watching the people. We also walked every day along the coast, hugging the Kapalua resort property -- great vistas, little company, what more could one ask for. Traveling to Maui also means Lahaina, trips to Hana, good restaurants, dancing, singing, etc., and we were most pleased with all we did on the trip. Remember, when you land go to COSTCO, the prices on the island are high -- join the locals in getting a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and good value”
Reviews.Author: hansolocujo
Reviews.Content: There is a single bedroom and a sofa bed in the living room. We are a family of four and found this more than enough space for us. Our 3 yr old slept in our bedroom. There is no air conditioning in the units at times it was warm but with the vents open there is a nice breeze that flows through the condo. The sprinklers do come on in the middle of the night and can wake you up at times when the vents are open in the bedroom. We also found the expedia excursion desk at the resort very helpful and prices were good too. Snorkeling is pretty good in turtle bay, just a short walk down the path from the condo, lots of turtles were there to be seen. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Unit, great view, great value- alittle far from shopping though”
Reviews.Author: ohana_kauai
Reviews.Content: I think we got the best unit at Napili Point. It wasn't cheap and run down. It was roomy and clean. We snorkeled in the bay right in front with sea turtles and watched the sunset over Lanai. We had the ocean front so we had a nice front yard and we sat outside everyday. The only downfall is that is is far from the airport, major shopping and harbor (if you are planning to go on a boat trip) so you really had to consider travel time. Especially during rush hour. There were two truck accidents in the one week we were there and it took us a long time coming back from the Kihei side up to Napili. But we also like the secludedness of Napili better than the busy and too touristy Kaanapali area. Closer to Lahaina, dining at the Hula Grill was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: LillianLM
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in Unit C-7 for 4 nights and we were delighted. This is a two bedroom unit, consisting of a decent sized living room/eating area, appropriately sized kitchen, master bedroom and a second bedroom which is a loft over the living area, and two bathrooms. The view is phenominal -- I just oozed happiness sitting on the lanai! The apartment itself is up a set of stairs, which may be a problem if you have strollers or other impediments. There is no air conditioning but cross ventilaion and fans worked well and we were comfortable. The grounds were very well maintained, with grassy areas and nice landscaping. Lovely swimming pool -- actually I believe there are 2 pools but we only saw one). To the left of the complex is a good snorkeling cove with many turtles and there is a good beach to the right -- both within walking distance. We really enjoyed our stay here and would return in a heartbeat! Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: mpugs
Reviews.Content: We just spent 9 days in a 2br condo at Napili Point. I hesitate to write a great review because I don't want the secret to get out -- but this is a great spot to be if you are looking for a beautiful but more low-key location. We loved our condo (29B) which was beautifully decorated and in perfect condition. There were beach chairs, noodles and (broken) boogie boards in the closet. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and the grounds were immaculate. We are beach people, and spent half the time at the Napili Bay and the other half at Fleming Beach where there are great waves this time of year.
