Our kids snorkeled with the turtles and everywhere else. In fact, the snorkeling was so beautiful out our back door that we actually canceled our reservations to Molikini! We did end up driving a bit, but it was not a problem since parking is easy virtually everywhere we went. We went to dinner in Kaanapali three times, and I didn't think it was nearly a beautiful as where we were. But if you like crowded beaches and packed restaurants then by all means stay there. If you are looking for a family-friendly and romantic atmosphere with smaller condos, a beautiful sandy beach on one side, a secluded bay with turtles on the other side, and no high-rise hotels then Napili is terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property/terrible privately owned unit”
Reviews.Author: Trixxee
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Napili Point for the second time, this time in unit A-25, reserved privately through VRBO. While there are many positives (proximity to a fantastic beach, view of the bay, saw 8 turtles one day!, quiet pools, nice landscaping, bbq's and picnic tables scattered about, generally beautiful area of Maui) we had the unfortunate luck to rent a unit that was very uncomfortable due to no air circulation. The way this particular unit was situated, there are only windows/slider on one side, therefore no cross breeze could be found. A large hedge was also in front of the unit thus blocking the breeze even more. You really couldn't use the oven or the washer and dryer because of the heat already inside the unit. We actually had to check out and find another place to stay and just bite the bullet on paying for two places. The owner was unresponsive regarding the situation. My advice is this - Napili Point is a wonderful place to stay but you have to be careful about which unit you rent and where it is situated. I would rent through the management office next time rather than a private party because if there is a problem, at least they are on site and can move you to another unit.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Maui....Loved the Condo”
Reviews.Author: seahagCA
Reviews.Content: We have never been to a condo so fully stocked with everything imaginable!! Every swimming equipment there is..boogie boards, snorkling gear, you name it they had it.!!!It was truly a delight!! It is homey and tropical decorated....lovely...and the view from the Lanai is beautiful....Beautiful homes across the cove...We had a wonderful time. We snorkeled in the cove and saw 3 turtles but they were either resting on some coral or went into a cave but was good enough for me. ..Gorgeous cove and glorious sunsets!! Also snorkeled Black Rock....much clearer than our cove but too crowded. We went bike riding down the Volcano....highlight of our trip. Great fun. Took the 7:00 ride....couldn't make it to the 2:30 sunset one....a tad early. Great breakfasts at the Gazebo just around the bend. I will be telling all my friends when they go to Maui to be sure and rent Napilipoint c37. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible spot and value!”
Reviews.Author: jspmama
Reviews.Content: This place is incredible. I was a bit leary at first since I got such a reasonable rate on our condo, but was pleasantly surprised once we arrived. Wow! We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo (C-30) Ocean View and we were literally steps from the beautiful cove where tons of sea turtles frolick all day. It was an incredible site to wake up to every morning and perfect for sunsets. The condo had tons of room, and although folks state that it was built in the 70's it was extremely well maintained and updated. Very clean. The snorkeling in the cove was tremendous and the beach (Napili Bay) is only a short trail away with numerous tide pools waiting to be explored along the way. Our kids LOVED playing on Napili Bay beach....great waves and beautiful sand. Napili Point is much quieter than the Kaanapali area, but not so much that we felt uncomfortable with our three kids (ages 9, 7, and 5 years). It was the best of both worlds....gorgeous views and scenery for us and a perfect beach for the kids....and us adults. It is an incredible value...especially for Maui. We HIGHLY recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: rogerj1
Reviews.Content: Great location. We loved the Napili area. Snippy service, aging building. If you don't mind staying in a room built in the 60's, you'll enjoy staying here. The rooms are very large with big kitchens, washer/dryer. The bathroom was tiny. Barely enough room to sit on the john and close the door. The furniture has kind of a musty aged smell. We told the front desk we were going to check out late at 1. They had someone checking in at 3. The front desk clerk felt he had to make a comment and sustain some drama that he might charge me for the late checkout. Unneccesary. Great snorkeling in the small bay in front of the property. We saw numerous sea turtles. You're able to walk down the beach to the Gazebo restaurant at the condo next door. There's always a wait there and I was able to leave my family at our room and call them when I was getting close to the front of the line.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: bobs1961
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say but another great stay at Napili Point. This was our third stay here, always over the Xmas holiday. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, C-17. This unit has been updated with queen size beds up and down and two full baths, one up and one down. Granite counter tops, dishwasher, and washer and dryer. Excellent views with quiet grounds with pools and grills. Great snorkeling in front and beautiful Napili bay within 1/2 block and stunning Kapalua Bay within two blocks. Have dinner at David Pauls(Lahaina) and The Plantation Restaurant(Kapalua) both pricey but fantastic. Ask for a "sunset " reservation at the Plantation House, your will not regret it ! Aloha !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at Napili point!”
Reviews.Author: idontemail
Reviews.Content: Wow! We absolutely loved Napili Point resort! I was very nervous since there have been no reviews since June, and they don't assign specific units before you get there. Once we arrived, we were upgraded from an oceanfront condo to a point oceanfront condo. We had a one bedroom, ground floor unit, which was well maintained and had some recent upgrades and did not look the 50 yrs old that it is. There was a dishwasher, washer/dryer, safe, hairdryer, blender and anything else we could need. They also provided daily maid service, though the service just replaced towels and made the beds (we were on our own for dishes and our other slobbish behaviors). Being on the ground floor allowed us to walk out from our patio (lanai?) right down to the cove (about 30 ft away) to snorkel with the sea turtles that live there. There were about 6-7 turtles there at most times. They would pop their heads up at all times of the day so you can see which direction to snorkel. It was so cool, they were like 2 feet away from us! We have two boys, 8 and 11, that were so amazed! There were also many beautiful colorful fish to see. The pools were also very nice, though we only visited one of them for about 20 minutes since the snorkeling was so cool and the beach was really nice (off to the right, past the Gazebo within walking distance). This location also provided an awesome view of Molokai in the distance. It really felt like we were someplace magical. Usually when we vacation, we figure "been there, done that", and won't go back anywhere since there are so many places on my list of things to see, but we are already trying to figure out how many frequent flyer miles we will need to get back here! Have been trying to submit photos, but somehow they were converted from jpg to bmp and I can't figure out how to change that. If I figure it out, I will add them later!

Reviews.Title: “Tranqulity Bay Maui Style”
Reviews.Author: Tenoka2000
Reviews.Content: What a great place! Thanks Jennifer at SaveonAloha(--) for sending us here, we were expecting a nice condo on the West side of Maui but this was The Bomb! My wife, three daughters(21, 17, 14) mom and I stayed here from June 4 - 8 and it was much more than we expected. We own timeshares and are used to condo style places to stay, after we finally gave up trying to exchange in to Mau we sought guidance from Jennifer who hooked us up here promising a great view, super snorkeling and location. This place really delivered. The development is a series of low rise condos located in Napilli which is on the NW tip of Maui. The complex is beautifully landscaped and has several gas BBQ grills scattered throughout (which have lighting attached so grilling at night is a breeze) on the "cliff" which overlooks an outrageous cove. I asked about prices for the units as each is privately owned and property mgt advised that the 2BR units were selling (when available that is) in the $950K price range. So here we were staying in a million dollar condo located on a cove with the best snorkeling we had in Hawaii! I cannot impress upon you how diverse, clear, calm and GORGEOUS this cove is. Each morning you'll see 6 or 7 sea turtles popping up around the cove getting air and then going back down to the reef to eat. We swam with at least two of these creatures which were as big as our coffee table. Way cool! The tropical fish were beautiful and compared with those we saw at Molokini (which we paid to take a sailboat out to). The units have NO A/C, but you don't need it as they open up really well and have ceiling fans throughout. The evenings in June were actually quite cool and the sound of the surf was really relaxing. If you walk along a sidewalk around the rear perimeter of the property it takes you to the adjacent property and a gorgeous golden sand beach. Its a shortt stroll and the beach is nice. Also about 10mins away from the property by car is Fleming Beach which the beach doctor rated the #1 beach in America this year. I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to swim with Sea Turtles”
Reviews.Author: Bonwald
Reviews.Content: Napili Point was the highlight of our stay in Maui! The Cove was filled with Sea Turtles every day and a great place to snorkle. The Views are excellent, the daily maid service was more then we could have ever asked for. Everyone who worked for Napili Point was so nice and helpful. We did have a slight problem with Bugs, but not so bad that it ruined our vacation. Great location, the Napili Market was very close by and very clean! While there try to go horseback riding at the ironwood Ranch, Great trails and nice people. Healthy and happy Horses, well taken care of. Naplil Beach is a short drive and the Best Beach on the whole Island. Parking is hard to come by so get there early. Sit in the shade and enjoy the whole day, then walk on the beach to the Gazebo for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever...Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Smith07
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from an eight day stay at Napili Point on Maui. I did alot of research before leaving and it all paid off. We rented condo C37 which is a privately held condo. You can view it at (--). It was a 2bd/2bath condo that was well supplied with cooking utensils and many extras. Our lanai overlooked a beautiful cove where the sea turtles loved to swim. The bay is a short walk, but had nice swimming and snorkling. My family and I explored several beaches and our favorites were Kapalua bay ( about a mile away) and Honoloa Bay for swimming and snorkling. Our least favorite was Kaanapali. Napili Point had two well maintained swimming pools, BBQ grills at varying points, and a free Mai Tai party on Mon. night. Our children are 7, 10, & 12 and they loved it as much as we did. I would recommend Napili Point and especially condo C37. Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Napili Point”
Reviews.Author: Jotripplanner
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wk. stay at Napili Point in a 1 bedroom condo. Traveled w/ our 2 kids (4 1/2 yrs.; 7 yrs.). We had stayed at the Point 15 yrs. ago before kids. Hasn't changed! Napili Bay is a great beach for kids, all low rise condos and very laid back atmosphere. The Point is a 5 min. walk down a path and across some rocks to the beach. It was a alittle bit of a challenge for the kids but fine. The condos vary depending on the owner. Ours was fine but hadn't been updated. We stayed on an end unit which meant there was a walkway betw. our unit and the next bldg. That made it alittle noisier as you could hear foot traffic at all hours. The condo had no a/c but okay b/c not too hot this time of yr. And kept window slates open (but then you hear outside noise better!). Washing machine/dryer in unit is a major plus. Only thing is the unit is in the hallway next to kitchen so noisy and made it hotter because dryer vent is in the interior. So tried to run washer/dryer when we were out of the unit or not sleeping. The view from our condo was amazing b/c it faces out to the ocean. The 1 bedroom ocean view unit (like ours) is on ground level below the 2 bedroom room units. The negative of that is you hear people walking around above. A lot of kids this time of year so we would hear feet walking around early in the a.m.! I later learned you can request specific unit, if available. Met another family who said they didn't like their unit and was able to choose among the ones available. Might have done that if I had known. The cove fronting the property has excellent snorkelling when conditions are calm (usually in the a.m.). Saw tons of sea turtles and all kinds of fish. Better than on the snorkeling cruise we took! The Gazebo restaurant for breakfast (next door at Napili Shores) was good for breakfast but gets busy early. Otherwise, we ate in everyday. When you check in, we got beach towels for the week. Housecleaning -- they changed bathroom towels everyday if you wanted. The property has 2 or 3 pools but not heated. So the kids didn't want to go in, ocean was warmer. A lot of families stay at the Point. It has all the amenities you needs and a great location. It is is not directly on the bay but so close and great views. Would definitely stay there again. If you are looking for kids activities, a big fun swimming pool, and more action, this is NOT the place to stay. But if you want a laid back, go at your own pace, and enjoy the beautiful cove and beach kind of stay, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Room Quality Varies Tremendously”
Reviews.Author: TruthfulTrudy
Reviews.Content: This resort rents condos that are privately owned when the owners are not using them. Unfortunately that means you get a wide variety of quality in rooms. Our first room was run down and in bad need of a complete remodel. The furnishings were worn, the tile grout moldy, and we had unwelcome creepy crawlys. After a night of misery, we went to management and were given a new room right next door. What a difference! Clean, updated, light and airy. A real delight. So beware....you may get a great condo, or one that is intolerable. The hotel/condo personnel vary almost as much as the rooms. Unable to locate a pool, we asked an employee of the condo, and were told that there were no pools! Being certain that this condo did have pools, we asked again the next day, and were told exactly where the pools were. Would also have to add, I will NEVER stay anywhere in Hawaii again that does not have air conditioning, which this hotel did not. It was very hot and unbelievably humid. One more big negative about this place....while the view is gorgeous, you have to walk about 10-15 minutes, through another resorts property to get to the beach. I would not recommend this property.

HotelInfo.Name: Napili Point Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 5295 Honoapiilani Rd, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
